title: Méditerranée (1963 film)
text: Méditerranée is a 1963 French experimental film directed by Jean-Daniel Pollet with assistance from Volker Schlöndorff.

title: Méditerranée (1963 film)

title: Méditerranée (1963 film)
text: The 45 minute film is cited as one of Pollet's most influential films, which according to Jonathan Rosenbaum directly influenced Jean-Luc Goddard's "Contempt", released later the same year.

title: Méditerranée (1963 film)
text: Footage for the film was shot around the Mediterranean, including at a Greek temple, a Sicilian garden, the sea, and also features a fisherman, a bullfighter, and a girl on an operating table.

title: The Falcon Takes Over
text: The Falcon Takes Over( also known as The Falcon Steps Out), is a 1942 black- and- white mystery film directed by Irving Reis.

title: The Falcon Takes Over
text: The B film was the third, following" The Gay Falcon" and" A Date with the Falcon"( 1941), to star George Sanders as the character Gay Lawrence, a gentleman detective known by the sobriquet the Falcon.

title: The Falcon Strikes Back
text: The Falcon Strikes Back( The Falcon Comes Back) is a 1943 American crime film directed by Edward Dmytryk and stars Tom Conway as the title character, the amateur sleuth, the Falcon.

title: The Falcon Strikes Back
text: Supporting roles are filled by Harriet Hilliard, Jane Randolph, Edgar Kennedy, with Cliff Edwards filling in for Allen Jenkins as the Falcon's sidekick," Goldie" Locke.

title: The Falcon Strikes Back
text: It is the sixth film in the Falcon series and the second for Conway, reprising the role that his brother, George Sanders had initiated.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: Vatroslav Mimica( born 25 June 1923) is a Croatian film director and screenwriter.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: Born in Omiš, Mimica had enrolled at the University of Zagreb School of Medicine before the outbreak of World War II.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: In 1942 he joined Young Communist League of Yugoslavia( SKOJ) and in 1943 he went on to join the Yugoslav Partisans, becoming a member of their medical units.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: After the war Mimica wrote literary and film reviews, and his career in filmmaking began in 1950 when he became the director of the Jadran Film production studio.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: He had his directorial and screenwriting debut in the 1952 Yugoslav film" In the Storm"( Croatian:" U oluji") which starred Veljko Bulajić, Mia Oremović and Antun Nalis.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: In the 1950s Mimica worked as a director and writer on a number of critically acclaimed animated films and became a prominent member of the Zagreb School of Animated Films( his 1958 animated short film" The LonerSamac") was awarded the Venice Grand Prix), along with authors such as Vlado Kristl and Academy Award- winning Dušan Vukotić.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: In the 1960s Mimica moved away from animation( his last animated film was 1971 film" The FiremenVatrogasci")) and turned to directing feature films, starting with the 1961 Yugoslav- Italian film" Suleiman the Conqueror"( Italian:" Solimano il conquistatore") starring Edmund Purdom and Giorgia Moll.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: His 1965 film" Prometheus of the IslandPrometej s otoka Viševice") won the Big Golden Arena for Best Film at the 1965 Pula Film Festival and earned Mimica a runner- up Silver Arena award for Best Director.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: It was also entered into the 4th Moscow International Film Festival winning a Special Diploma.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: The following year his 1966 film" Monday or TuesdayPonedjeljak ili utorak") also won the Big Golden Arena for Best Film and Mimica won the Golden Arena for Best Director.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: Mimica made several other films through the 1970s, most notably the period films" Anno Domini 1573( Peasant revolt of 1573) Seljačka buna 1573." in Croatian- depicting the 16th century Croatian- Slovenian peasant revolt, and" The FalconBanović Strahinja"), set in 14th century Serbia, before retiring from filmmaking in 1981.

title: Vatroslav Mimica
text: His son Sergio Mimica- Gezzan is an American film and television director.

title: The Falcon and the Co-eds
text: The Falcon and the Co-eds is a 1943 film under the direction of William Clemens, and produced by Maurice Geraghty, the same team that had worked on" The Falcon in Danger"( 1943) and would stay together for the next film in the Falcon series.

title: The Falcon and the Co-eds

title: Martin Frič

title: Martin Frič
text: He died in the hospital five days later.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Danger:

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Diabolik is a 1968 action film directed and co-written by Mario Bava, based on the Italian comic series "Diabolik" by Angela and Luciana Giussani.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: The film is about a criminal named Diabolik (John Phillip Law), who plans large-scale heists for his girlfriend Eva Kant (Marisa Mell).

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Diabolik is pursued by Inspector Ginko (Michel Piccoli), who blackmails the gangster Ralph Valmont (Adolfo Celi) into catching Diabolik for him.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: An adaptation of the comics was originally envisioned by producer Tonino Cervi, who hired director Seth Holt and began producing the film as an international co-production with a cast that included Jean Sorel, Elsa Martinelli and Gilbert Roland.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Appalled with the quality of the footage that had been shot, distributor Dino De Laurentiis took over production duties and restarted filming from scratch.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Working from a new screenplay and under creative pressure from De Laurentiis, Bava directed the film on a reduced budget, with established actors taking smaller roles.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: The film was produced in tandem with De Laurentiis' other comic book adaptation of that year, "Barbarella", with both films sharing several cast and crew members.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: Upon its theatrical release, "Danger: Diabolik" performed below De Laurentiis' expectations at the box office, and received negative reviews from "The New York Times" and "Variety".

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: With the re-evaluation of Bava's filmography, retrospective reception of the film has been more positive, with critics praising its visuals, the performances of Law and Mell, and the score by Ennio Morricone.

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: In 2008, it was chosen by "Empire" magazine as one of "The 500 Greatest Movies of All Time".

title: Danger: Diabolik
text: A new adaptation of "Diabolik" by the Manetti Bros. was announced in 2018.

title: Mario Bava
text: Mario Bava (31 July 1914 – 27 April 1980) was an Italian cinematographer, director, special effects artist and screenwriter, frequently referred to as the "Master of Italian Horror" and the "Master of the Macabre".

title: Mario Bava
text: His low-budget genre films, known for their distinctive visual flair and technical ingenuity, feature recurring themes and imagery concerning the conflict between illusion and reality, and the destructive capacity of human nature.

title: Mario Bava
text: Born to sculptor, cinematographer and special effects pioneer Eugenio Bava, the younger Bava followed his father into the film industry, and eventually earned a reputation as one of Italy's foremost cameramen, lighting and providing the special effects for such films as "Hercules" (1958) and its sequel "Hercules Unchained" (1959)

title: Mario Bava
text: (each were lampooned on "Mystery Science Theater 3000").

title: Mario Bava
text: During the late 1950s, his eventual career trajectory as a director began when he was relied upon to complete projects begun by or credited to his colleague Riccardo Freda and other filmmakers, including "I Vampiri" (1957) (the first Italian horror film of the sound era), "The Day the Sky Exploded" (1958) (the first Italian science fiction film), "Caltiki – The Immortal Monster" (1959) and "The Giant of Marathon" (1959).

title: Mario Bava
text: Although most of Bava's films as director failed to achieve major commercial success upon release, many of them would eventually find acclaim as cult classics, with their content and production values being favourably compared to the works of Alfred Hitchcock.

title: Mario Bava
text: Several of them have been noted for their revolutionary impact on their respective genres: "Black Sunday" (1960), his official directorial debut, was the forerunner of the Italian gothic horror film cycle; "The Girl Who Knew Too Much" (1963) is considered to be the first giallo film; "Kill, Baby, Kill" (1966) heavily influenced the iconography of modern J-Horror; "Roy Colt & Winchester Jack" (1970) is regarded as one of the earliest self-parodying Spaghetti Westerns; "

title: Mario Bava
text: Four Times That Night" (1971) was an early Italian sex comedy; and "A Bay of Blood" (1971) was a precursor to slasher films.

title: Mario Bava
text: His other notable films include "Hercules in the Haunted World" (1961), "Erik the Conqueror" (1961), "Black Sabbath" (1963), "The Whip and the Body" (1963), "Blood and Black Lace" (1964), "Planet of the Vampires" (1965), "Knives of the Avenger" (1966), (1968), "Hatchet for the Honeymoon" (1970), "Five Dolls for an August Moon" (1970), "Baron Blood" (1972), "Lisa and the Devil" (1974), "Rabid Dogs" (1974) and "Shock" (1977).

title: Mario Bava
text: Despite his reputation as a talented artist during his lifetime, Bava's shy, self-deprecating demeanour prevented him from taking advantage of opportunities that would have furthered his international standing within the film industry, and he turned down multiple opportunities to work in Hollywood.

title: Mario Bava
text: Among the filmmakers Bava and his work have influenced include Dario Argento, Lucio Fulci, Federico Fellini, John Carpenter, Nicolas Winding Refn, Martin Scorsese, Tim Burton, Joe Dante, John Landis, Francis Ford Coppola, Roger Corman, Edgar Wright, Jennifer Kent and Quentin Tarantino.

title: Mario Bava
text: His son and frequent assistant director, Lamberto Bava, later became a noted fantasy and horror film director in his own right.

title: Mina Gerhardsen
text: degree at the University of Oslo in 1998, and also has master's degrees in pedagogy from 2000 and human geography from 2003.

text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Rolling Meadows High School
text: Rolling Meadows High School, RMHS, is a public four-year high school located in Rolling Meadows, Illinois, a northwest suburb of Chicago, Illinois, in the United States.

title: Rolling Meadows High School

title: Rolling Meadows High School

title: Rolling Meadows High School

title: Rolling Meadows High School

title: Schaumburg High School

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The Ottawa High School and Junior High School, located at 526 and 506 S. Main St. respectively, are the historic former high school and junior high school in Ottawa, Kansas.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The high school was built in 1917, while the junior high school was built from 1927 to 1928; an enclosed hallway connecting the two buildings was built with the junior high school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The high school was the first school in Ottawa to be built solely as a high school and the eighth school built in Ottawa.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: George P. Washburn& Son designed the high school in the Collegiate Gothic style.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: When the junior high school was constructed ten years later, the firm, by then known as Washburn& Stookey, designed the building in the same style as the high school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: In 1966, a new high school was built for the upper three classes of students; the freshman class moved to the building in 1976, and the old high school and junior high school became a middle school.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The two buildings were connected by a multi-purpose room in the same year.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The middle school later vacated the building.

title: Ottawa High School and Junior High School
text: The school was added to the National Register of Historic Places on October 6, 2000.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: Endeavour Sports High School( abbreviated as ESHS) is a government- funded co-educational comprehensive and specialist secondary day school, with speciality in sports, located in Caringbah, a southern suburb of Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: Established in 1964 as Endeavour High School, the school caters to approximately 1,000 students from Year 7 to Year 12.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: It is a selective, comprehensive co-educational school which bases its enrolment on students being proficient in a targeted sport or living in the relatively small local catchment area of the school.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: The school is operated by the New South Wales Department of Education; the principal is James Kozlowski.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: Endeavour Sports High School is a member of the NSW Sports High Schools Association.

title: Endeavour Sports High School
text: The school's alumni include many former and current sportspeople, and Endeavour Sports High School is well regarded in its sporting development of its students.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: Illawarra Sports High School is a government- funded co-educational comprehensive and specialist secondary day school, with speciality in sports, located in Berkeley, a southern suburb of Wollongong, in the Illawarra region of New South Wales, Australia.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: Established in 1956 as the Berkeley High School, the school changed its name in 1998 in line with becoming a sports- oriented school.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: The Illawarra Sports High School caters for approximately 740 students in 2018, from Year 7 to Year 12, of whom 13 percent identified as Indigenous Australians and 27 percent were from a language background other than English.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: The school draws the majority of its students from the southern Wollongong area; with an increasing number of students from the larger Illawarra area who access its specialist sports programs.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: The school is operated by the New South Wales Department of Education; the principal is Gary Hampton.

title: Illawarra Sports High School
text: Illawarra Sports High School is a member of the NSW Sports High Schools Association.

title: Wabash High School

title: Wabash High School

title: Narrabeen Sports High School
text: Narrabeen Sports High School( abbreviated as NSHS) is a government- funded co-educational comprehensive and specialist secondary day school, with speciality in sports, located on Namona Street and Pittwater Road, in North Narrabeen, in the northern beaches region of Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.

title: Narrabeen Sports High School
text: Established in 1954 as Narrabeen Girls' High School and in 1959 as Narrabeen Boys' High School, the schools merged in 1976 to form Narrabeen High School; and then, in 2000, became the first specialist sports high school in New South Wales as Narrabeen Sports High School.

title: Narrabeen Sports High School
text: The school caters for approximately 850 students from Year 7 to Year 12.

title: Narrabeen Sports High School

title: Narrabeen Sports High School
text: Narrabeen Sports High School is a member of the NSW Sports High Schools Association.

title: Matraville Sports High School

title: Matraville Sports High School
text: Established in 1960 as Matraville High School, the school became a specialist high school in December 2001 and caters for approximately 300 students from Year 7 to Year 12.

title: Matraville Sports High School
text: The school is operated by the New South Wales Department of Education; the principal is Nerida Walker.

title: Matraville Sports High School

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: < onlyinclude>

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: In August 2015, Boye Brogeland's team( Richard Schwartz, Allan Graves, Boye Brogeland, Espen Lindqvist, Huub Bertens, Daniel Korbel) lost in the quarter- finals of the Spingold to Jimmy Cayne's team( James Cayne, Michael Seamon, Lotan Fisher, Ron Schwartz, Alfredo Versace, Lorenzo Lauria) by 1 IMP following an appeal that lost his team 2 IMPs.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: The appeal involved Lotan Fisher and Ron Schwartz, Brogeland's teammates from the previous year when they won the Spingold.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: Brogeland spent the following day reviewing the Vugraph records from the quarter- final and concluded that Fisher and Schwartz were cheating and later that month created a web site and publicly accused them of cheating.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: In September 2015, Per- Ola Cullin, a Swedish international bridge player, postulated that after removing the board from the bidding tray, Fisher and Schwartz placed it in particular locations as a code to indicate strength in a suit.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: The analysis was based on video from the European Bridge Team Championship in Croatia in 2014.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: Both the European Bridge League and the Israel Bridge Federation conducted an investigation into the allegations.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: The Israel Bridge Federation hearings also includes an allegation related to coughing.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: On September 5, 2015, Israel withdrew its team for the upcoming Bermuda Bowl in Bali.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: They were replaced by Sweden.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: In May 2016 three Israeli experts announced what they believe is a refinement to the Cullin code.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: The experts include Dr. Netzer Zeidenberg, a computer scientist and Amir Levin, Israel's 2003 bridge champion.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: Fisher and Schwartz responded," We are innocent of any crime and we will fight for our innocence.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: We already successfully passed a polygraph that proved that we are innocent."

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: Fisher and Schwartz were subsequently banned from all European Bridge League events in May 2016 by its Disciplinary Commission for a period of five years, and banned from playing as a partnership for life.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: The Committee's full report was released on May 18, 2016 as the Decision of the European Bridge League Disciplinary Committee.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: On July 28, 2016, the American Contract Bridge League( ACBL) announced that its Ethical Oversight Committee( chair: Jon Brissman; other members: Cheri Bjerkan, Dennis Clerkin, Lesley Davis, Bruce Ferguson, Bob Glasson, Hendrik Sharples and Eddie Wold) had unanimously found Fisher and Schwartz guilty both of collusive cheating and of giving false information to the ACBL about previous disciplinary convictions.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: In consequence, Fisher and Schwartz were expelled from the ACBL, and all their masterpoints, titles, ranks and privileges declared forfeit.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: Further, their partners and teammates were subject to mandatory forfeiture of all masterpoints, titles and ranks earned during the four years preceding the final of the 2015 Spingold Trophy.

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: On July 29, 2016, the ACBL clarified and corrected that announcement: forfeiture by partners and teammates applied only to events in which they had played with Fisher or Schwartz, and only to the four years preceding the date of the decision, namely July 27, 2016. </onlyinclude>

title: Fisher and Schwartz cheating scandal
text: On August 8, 2016, the Israeli Special Ethics Committee unanimously found Fisher and Schwartz guilty of signaling by means of board placement and on February 14, 2017, announced that Fisher and Schwartz are permanently banned from play and participation in any activities within the Israeli Bridge Federation.

title: Neil Young
text: Neil Percival Young (born November 12, 1945) is a Canadian singer-songwriter.

title: Neil Young
text: After embarking on a music career in the 1960s, he moved to Los Angeles, where he formed Buffalo Springfield with Stephen Stills, Richie Furay and others.

title: Neil Young
text: Young had released two solo albums and three as a member of Buffalo Springfield by the time he joined Crosby, Stills & Nash in 1969.

title: Neil Young
text: From his early solo albums and those with his backing band Crazy Horse, Young has recorded a steady stream of studio and live albums, sometimes warring with his recording company along the way.

title: Neil Young
text: Young's guitar work, deeply personal lyrics and signature tenor singing voice define his long career.

title: Neil Young
text: Young also plays piano and harmonica on many albums, which frequently combine folk, rock, country and other musical styles.

title: Neil Young
text: His often distorted electric guitar playing, especially with Crazy Horse, earned him the nickname "Godfather of Grunge" and led to his 1995 album "Mirror Ball" with Pearl Jam.

title: Neil Young
text: More recently Young has been backed by Promise of the Real.

title: Neil Young
text: Young directed (or co-directed) films using the pseudonym "Bernard Shakey", including "Journey Through the Past" (1973),

title: Neil Young
text: "Rust Never Sleeps" (1979), "Human Highway" (1982), "Greendale" (2003), and "CSNY/Déjà Vu" (2008).

title: Neil Young
text: He also contributed to the soundtracks of the films "Philadelphia" (1993) and "Dead Man" (1995).

title: Neil Young
text: Young has received several Grammy and Juno awards.

title: Neil Young
text: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inducted him twice: as a solo artist in 1995 and in 1997 as a member of Buffalo Springfield.

title: Neil Young
text: In 2000, "Rolling Stone" named Young the 34th greatest rock 'n roll artist.

title: Neil Young
text: He has lived in California since the 1960s but retains Canadian citizenship.

title: Neil Young
text: He was awarded the Order of Manitoba on July 14, 2006, and was made an Officer of the Order of Canada on December 30, 2009.

title: Elvis Presley
text: Elvis Aaron Presley

title: Elvis Presley
text: (January 8, 1935 – August 16, 1977), also known mononymously as Elvis, was an American singer and actor.

title: Elvis Presley
text: Regarded as one of the most significant cultural icons of the 20th century, he is often referred to as the "King of Rock and Roll" or simply "the King".

title: Elvis Presley
text: Presley was born in Tupelo, Mississippi, and relocated to Memphis, Tennessee with his family when he was 13 years old.

title: Elvis Presley
text: His music career began there in 1954, recording at Sun Records with producer Sam Phillips, who wanted to bring the sound of African-American music to a wider audience.

title: Elvis Presley
text: Presley, on rhythm acoustic guitar, and accompanied by lead guitarist Scotty Moore and bassist Bill Black, was a pioneer of rockabilly, an uptempo, backbeat-driven fusion of country music and rhythm and blues.

title: Elvis Presley
text: In 1955, drummer D. J. Fontana joined to complete the lineup of Presley's classic quartet and RCA Victor acquired his contract in a deal arranged by Colonel Tom Parker, who would manage him for more than two decades.

title: Elvis Presley
text: Presley's first RCA single, "Heartbreak Hotel", was released in January 1956 and became a number-one hit in the United States.

title: Elvis Presley
text: With a series of successful network television appearances and chart-topping records, he became the leading figure of the newly popular sound of rock and roll.

title: Elvis Presley
text: His energized interpretations of songs and sexually provocative performance style, combined with a singularly potent mix of influences across color lines during a transformative era in race relations, made him enormously popular—and controversial.

title: Elvis Presley
text: In November 1956, Presley made his film debut in "Love Me Tender".

title: Elvis Presley
text: Drafted into military service in 1958, Presley relaunched his recording career two years later with some of his most commercially successful work.

title: Elvis Presley
text: He held few concerts however, and guided by Parker, proceeded to devote much of the 1960s to making Hollywood films and soundtrack albums, most of them critically derided.

title: Elvis Presley
text: In 1968, following a seven-year break from live performances, he returned to the stage in the acclaimed television comeback special "Elvis", which led to an extended Las Vegas concert residency and a string of highly profitable tours.

title: Elvis Presley
text: In 1973, Presley gave the first concert by a solo artist to be broadcast around the world, "Aloha from Hawaii".

title: Elvis Presley
text: Years of prescription drug abuse severely compromised his health, and he died suddenly in 1977 at his Graceland estate at the age of 42.

title: Elvis Presley
text: Presley is the best-selling solo artist in the history of recorded music.

title: Elvis Presley
text: He was commercially successful in many genres, including pop, country, blues, and gospel.

title: Elvis Presley
text: He won three competitive Grammys, received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award at age 36, and has been inducted into multiple music halls of fame.

text: Motherland is the place of one's birth, the place of one's ancestors, or the place of origin of an ethnic group.

title: Where Was I

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born.

title: Place of birth
text: This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live.

title: Place of birth
text: If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947.

title: Place of birth
text: This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth".

title: Place of birth
text: It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: Maurice Campbell (November 28, 1919 – July 4, 2014) was a Canadian curler from Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: Campbell was born November 28, 1919 in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: Educated at the University of Montreal, he joined the Royal Canadian Army Medical Corps in 1943 and completed his medical degree in 1945 and was subsequently posted in Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: He was a specialist in rheumatology and internal medicine and practiced in Cap-de-la-Madeleine, Quebec.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: Campbell played in the 1958 Macdonald Brier, playing lead for the Quebec team, skipped by Bob Lahaie.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: The team finished 9th, with a 3-7 record.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: He was President of the Quebec Curling Association for the 1963-64 season.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: He served as president of the Canadian Curling Association for the 1970-71 season and was named to the Canadian Curling Hall of Fame.

title: Maurice Campbell
text: Campbell died in Trois-Rivières on July 4, 2014.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: SCR (restaurant)
text: SCR Corporation Sdn Bhd (doing business as SCR) is a Malaysian halal-certified chicken rice fast-food restaurant in Sarawak.

title: SCR (restaurant)
text: The chain is operated by SCR Corporation Sdn Bhd which was established in 1987.

title: SCR (restaurant)
text: Since its birth, SCR Corporation Sdn Bhd has grown to become one of East Malaysia's biggest home grown food names with international outlets in Brunei and Indonesia.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Silterra Malaysia

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Sdn.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Bhd. is a Malaysian semiconductor manufacturer founded in November 1995.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Silterra Malaysia

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Sdn. Bhd. was formerly known as Wafer Technology( Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd. and changed its name to Silterra Malaysia Sdn. Bhd. in December 1999.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: The company was founded in 1995 and is based in Kulim, Malaysia, with sales and marketing offices in San Jose, California; and Hsinchu, Taiwan.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Silterra is started as a project of strategic national interest to promote front- end semiconductor manufacturing and a catalyst for high technology investments in Malaysia.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Since its inception, Silterra has served many top- tier global fabless design and product companies covering the consumer electronics, communications& computing, and mobile device market segments.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: The company was owned by Khazanah Nasional.

title: Silterra Malaysia
text: Najib says government open to selling Silterra Malaysia at Kedah stake to foreign investors.

title: Infopro Sdn Bhd
text: INFOPRO Sdn Bhd ('Infopro') is an certified and a CMMi Level 5 appraised Malaysian based software house that specialises in core banking that provides front and back end banking solutions known as eICBA system.

title: Infopro Sdn Bhd
text: The eICBA system consists of core banking system known as ICBA (Integrated Computerised Banking System) and systems for Business Intelligence, ATM, e-Switch, Internet Banking and Telebanking.

title: Infopro Sdn Bhd
text: The core banking system also handles Islamic banking

title: Infopro Sdn Bhd
text: Infopro won the Ministry of International Trade and Industry (MITI)'s Export Excellence Award (Services) in 2010.

title: Infopro Sdn Bhd

title: U Mobile
text: U Mobile Sdn Bhd (223969-U) is a Malaysian mobile telecommunications service provider and was founded in 1998 as MiTV Networks Sdn Bhd.

title: U Mobile
text: U Mobile is a wholly owned subsidiary of U Television Sdn Bhd, which was formerly known as U Telecom Media Holdings Sdn Bhd and MiTV Corporation Sdn Bhd.

title: U Mobile
text: The company utilises the 018 and 011 prefix allocated to the organisation by the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC), although with the implementation of mobile number portability mandated by the Malaysian government this does not apply to subscribers who switched from their old mobile service provider over to U Mobile.

title: SME Ordnance

title: SME Ordnance
text: SMEO is a subsidiary company of National Aerospace and Defence Industries Sdn Bhd.

title: DRB-HICOM
text: DRB-HICOM Berhad is one of Malaysia's leading corporations, involved in the automotive manufacturing, assembly and distribution industry through its involvement in the passenger car and four wheel drive vehicle market segment, the national truck project and the national motorcycle project.

title: DRB-HICOM
text: DRB-HICOM assembles cars in Malaysia for Tata Motors, Honda, Isuzu, Mercedes-Benz and Volkswagen, with plans for expansion.

title: DRB-HICOM

title: VakıfBank
text: VakıfBank is the fifth (5th) largest bank in Turkey with its $46 billion in assets as of December 31, 2009.

title: VakıfBank
text: The company offers some of the largest services in Turkey, and operates 610 branches domestically.

title: VakıfBank
text: VakifBank has two international offices located in New York and Bahrain and it also has participation in Austria named "VakifBank International AG" which has branches in Vienna, Cologne and Frankfurt.

title: VakıfBank
text: VakıfBank was founded on April 13, 1954 under the special law "Türkiye Vakıflar Bankası Türk Anonim Ortaklığı Kanunu".

title: VakıfBank
text: VakıfBank’s initial purpose was the management of the cash revenues and expenditures of the charitable foundations set up during the Ottoman Empire period.

title: VakıfBank
text: VakıfBank was established in Ankara and quickly began conducting banking activities with branch offices in Istanbul, Ankara and İzmir.

title: Rapid Rail
text: Rapid Rail

title: Rapid Rail
text: Sdn

title: Rapid Rail
text: Bhd( styled as" rapidrail") was established to place all three rail operators for" Sistem Transit Aliran Ringan Sdn Bhd( STAR- LRT) Projek Usahasama Transit Ringan Automatik Sdn

title: Rapid Rail
text: Bhd( PUTRA- LRT)" and" KL Starrail Sdn Bhd" – under one administrating umbrella in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

title: Rapid Rail
text: Rapid Rail currently operates five rail lines.

title: Rapid Rail
text: These are the LRT Ampang and Sri Petaling, LRT Kelana Jaya, KL Monorail and MRT Sungai Buloh- Kajang Lines.

title: Rapid Rail
text: These rapid transit systems are known collectively as" Rapid KL".

title: Rapid Rail
text: The five rail lines operate on standard gauge rail, while the KL Monorail operates on an ALWEG straddle beam.

title: Rapid Rail
text: Train services operate from 6.00 a.m and typically end before midnight daily, with frequencies varying from approximately three minutes during peak hours to fourteen minutes during non-peak hours.

title: Rapid Rail
text: The Ampang and Kelana Jaya lines were constructed and initially operated by different owners: Sistem Transit Aliran Ringan Sdn. Bhd.( STAR- LRT) for the Ampang Line starting in 1995, and Projek Usahasama Transit Ringan Automatik( PUTRA- LRT) for the Kelana Jaya Line starting in 1998.

title: Rapid Rail
text: In 2004, operational aspects of the two LRT lines were transferred to Rapid Rail Sdn

title: Rapid Rail
text: Bhd under the second phase of the restructuring process of Kuala Lumpur's public transportation network.

title: Rapid Rail
text: The KL Monorail was initially owned and operated by KL Starrail Sdn Bhd, from 2003 until 2007, until the company declared bankruptcy.

title: Rapid Rail
text: As a result, Prasarana purchased the monorail and gave operating rights to their subsidiary Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd.

title: Mukasa Mbidde
text: Fred Mukasa Mbidde( Born 15 October 1974) is a Ugandan lawyer, human-rights activist, mass communication specialist, motivational speaker and politician.

title: Mukasa Mbidde

title: Mukasa Mbidde

title: Mukasa Mbidde

title: Mukasa Mbidde
text: He first gained prominence in 2001 when serving as the Guild President for Makerere University.

title: Mukasa Mbidde
text: He played a significant role in the" Save Mabira Riots" that took place in Uganda in the year 2007.

title: Mukasa Mbidde

title: Mukasa Mbidde

title: David Ji
text: David Longfen Ji is an American businessman who co-founded Apex Digital, an electronics manufacturer.

title: David Ji
text: In 2004, he was arrested in China following a dispute with Sichuan Changhong Electric, a supplier owned by the city of Mianyang and the province of Sichuan.

title: David Ji
text: Changhong accused him of defrauding them through bad checks.

title: David Ji
text: Ji was taken, according to an account by his lawyer, to the senior management and told, "I decide whether you live or die."

title: David Ji
text: He has been held in China without charges.

title: David Ji
text: Ji's case highlighted an "implicit racism" in dealings with American businessmen.

title: David Ji
text: As a U.S. citizen he was not granted the same treatment by authorities as non-ethnically Chinese businessmen sharing the same nationality.

title: Fourth umpire
text: The fourth umpire( sometimes referred to as the reserve umpire), is a cricket umpire.

title: Fourth umpire
text: For all international matches a fourth umpire is required to perform duties like bringing on the new ball, carrying drinks on to the field for the umpires, checking the batteries in the light meter, observing the pitch during the lunch and tea intervals to make sure there is no interference, or bringing on new bails.

title: Fourth umpire
text: The Fourth umpire will take over the Third umpire duties if something happens to one of the on- field umpires, as the rules state the third umpire will take over on- field duties.

title: Fourth umpire
text: For Test matches, the fourth umpire is appointed by the home side's Governing body from their nominees to the International Panel of ICC Umpires, so is the same nationality as the home side.

title: University of Birmingham
text: The University of Birmingham (informally Birmingham University) is a public research university located in Edgbaston, Birmingham, United Kingdom.

title: University of Birmingham
text: It received its royal charter in 1900 as a successor to Queen's College, Birmingham (founded in 1825 as the Birmingham School of Medicine and Surgery) and Mason Science College (established in 1875 by Sir Josiah Mason), making it the first English civic or 'red brick' university to receive its own royal charter.

title: University of Birmingham
text: It is a founding member of both the Russell Group of British research universities and the international network of research universities, Universitas 21.

title: University of Birmingham
text: The university was ranked 14th in the UK and 79th in the world in the QS World University Rankings for 2019.

title: University of Birmingham
text: In 2013, Birmingham was named 'University of the Year 2014' in the "Times Higher Education" awards.

title: University of Birmingham
text: The 2017 Global Employability University Ranking places Birmingham at 142nd worldwide and 10th in the UK.

title: University of Birmingham
text: Birmingham is also ranked 5th in the UK for Graduate Prospects in The Times and The Sunday Times Good University Guide 2018.

title: University of Birmingham
text: The student population includes undergraduate and postgraduate students, which is the largest in the UK (out of).

title: University of Birmingham
text: The annual income of the institution for 2017–18 was £673.8 million of which

title: University of Birmingham
text: £134.2 million was from research grants and contracts, with an expenditure of £663.2 million.<ref name="Birmingham

title: University of Birmingham
text: Financial Statement 17/18"></ref>

title: University of Birmingham
text: The university is home to the Barber Institute of Fine Arts, housing works by Van Gogh, Picasso and Monet; the Shakespeare Institute; the Cadbury Research Library, home to the Mingana Collection of Middle Eastern manuscripts; the Lapworth Museum of Geology; and the 100-metre Joseph Chamberlain Memorial Clock Tower, which is a prominent landmark visible from many parts of the city.

title: University of Birmingham
text: Academics and alumni of the university include former British Prime Ministers Neville Chamberlain and Stanley Baldwin, the British composer Sir Edward Elgar and eleven Nobel laureates.

title: Terry Slater (geographer)
text: Canon Doctor Terry Slater is an honorary senior research fellow in Historical Geography at the University of Birmingham, UK.

title: Terry Slater (geographer)
text: Born in Bromley but raised in Charlton he was educated at Hull University, University College, London and the University of Birmingham.

title: Terry Slater (geographer)
text: He joined the University of Birmingham as a lecturer in 1971 and continued until retirement.

title: Terry Slater (geographer)
text: He devoted a lot of his spare time to the Church of England in Birmingham that led to him being made an honorary Lay Canon of St Philip's Cathedral, Birmingham in 2005.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Joseph Chamberlain (8 July 1836 – 2 July 1914) was a British statesman who was first a radical Liberal, then, after opposing home rule for Ireland, a Liberal Unionist, and eventually served as a leading imperialist in coalition with the Conservatives.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He split both major British parties in the course of his career.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Chamberlain made his career in Birmingham, first as a manufacturer of screws

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: and then as a notable mayor of the city.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He was a radical Liberal Party member and an opponent of the Elementary Education Act 1870 on the basis that it could result in subsidising Church of England schools with local ratepayers' money.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: As a self-made businessman, he had never attended university and had contempt for the aristocracy.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He entered the House of Commons at 39 years of age, relatively late in life compared to politicians from more privileged backgrounds.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Rising to power through his influence with the Liberal grassroots organisation, he served as President of the Board of Trade in Gladstone's Second Government (1880–85).

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: At the time, Chamberlain was notable for his attacks on the Conservative leader Lord Salisbury, and in the 1885 general election he proposed the "Unauthorised Programme", which was not enacted, of benefits for newly enfranchised agricultural labourers, including the slogan promising "three acres and a cow".

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Chamberlain resigned from Gladstone's Third Government in 1886 in opposition to Irish Home Rule.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He helped to engineer a Liberal Party split and became a Liberal Unionist, a party which included a bloc of MPs based in and around Birmingham.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: From the 1895 general election the Liberal Unionists were in coalition with the Conservative Party, under Chamberlain's former opponent Lord Salisbury.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: In that government Chamberlain promoted the Workmen's Compensation Act 1897.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He served as Secretary of State for the Colonies, promoting a variety of schemes to build up the Empire in Asia, Africa, and the West Indies.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He had major responsibility for causing the Second Boer War (1899–1902) in South Africa and was the government minister most responsible for the war effort.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He became a dominant figure in the Unionist Government's re-election at the "Khaki Election" in 1900.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: In 1903, he resigned from the Cabinet to campaign for tariff reform (i.e. taxes on imports as opposed to the existing policy of free trade with no tariffs).

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He obtained the support of most Unionist MPs for this stance, but the Unionists suffered a landslide defeat at the 1906 general election.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Shortly after public celebrations of his 70th birthday in Birmingham, he was disabled by a stroke, ending his public career.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Despite never becoming Prime Minister, he was one of the most important British politicians of his day, as well as a renowned orator and municipal reformer.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: Historian David Nicholls notes that his personality was not attractive: he was arrogant and ruthless and much hated.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He never succeeded in his grand ambitions.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: However, he was a highly proficient grassroots organizer of democratic instincts, and played the central role in winning the Second Boer War.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
text: He is most famous for setting the agenda of British colonial, foreign, tariff and municipal policies, and for deeply splitting both major political parties.

title: Joseph E. Johnson (academic)
text: Joseph Edwin Johnson( born July 9, 1933) is an American academic.

title: Joseph E. Johnson (academic)

title: Joseph E. Johnson (academic)

title: Matt Thompson (priest)
text: Matthew Thompson( born 1968) is a British Anglican priest.

title: Matt Thompson (priest)

title: Matt Thompson (priest)
text: He was previously, since 2008, vicar of Bolton Parish Church in the Diocese of Manchester.

title: David Sylvester (academic)
text: David Sylvester is president of University of St. Michael's College, University of Toronto, Canada.

title: David Ji
text: David Longfen Ji is an American businessman who co-founded Apex Digital, an electronics manufacturer.

title: David Ji
text: In 2004, he was arrested in China following a dispute with Sichuan Changhong Electric, a supplier owned by the city of Mianyang and the province of Sichuan.

title: David Ji
text: Changhong accused him of defrauding them through bad checks.

title: David Ji
text: Ji was taken, according to an account by his lawyer, to the senior management and told, "I decide whether you live or die."

title: David Ji
text: He has been held in China without charges.

title: David Ji
text: Ji's case highlighted an "implicit racism" in dealings with American businessmen.

title: David Ji
text: As a U.S. citizen he was not granted the same treatment by authorities as non-ethnically Chinese businessmen sharing the same nationality.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis II was king of half of the Odrysian kingdom of Thrace from 12 to 18, in succession to his brother Rhoemetalces I, and briefly ruler of the entire realm thereafter, usurping the other half from nephew Cotys VIII.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: He was a son of the earlier Thracian king Cotys VI and the younger brother of kings Cotys VII and Rhoemetalces I.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: The Roman Historian Tacitus describes his character as "treacherous".

title: Rhescuporis II
text: On the death of Rhoemetalces, Emperor Augustus divided Thrace into two separate kingdoms, one half for Cotys VIII to rule and the other half for Rhescuporis II.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Tacitus states that Cotys received the cultivated parts, most towns and most Greek cities of Thrace, while Rhescuporis received the wild and savage portion with enemies on its frontier.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis wanted to annex Cotys’ kingdom, but was prevented from doing so from fear of Augustus.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Augustus' death in 14 emboldened him, and he initiated efforts to obtain the remainder of Thrace, at first by negotiation, but afterwards, when Cotys proved resistant, by treachery.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Inviting his nephew to a banquet to falsely ratify a treaty between them, he arrested and imprisoned Cotys, seizing his kingdom.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Cotys died while incarcerated in 18, allegedly by suicide.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: His wife and children fled Thrace to Cyzicus to escape Rhescuporis.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: The Roman Emperor Tiberius opened an investigation into Cotys’ death, putting Rhescuporis on trial in the Roman Senate.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: He invited Cotys' widow Tryphaena to testify at the trial, during which she accused the defendant of murdering her husband.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis was found guilty, and Tiberius sent him to live in exile in Alexandria, Egypt.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: En route, Rhescuporis tried to escape and was killed by Roman soldiers.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: His son, who would later rule Thrace as Rhoemetalces III, was spared by Tiberius and allowed to return to Thrace.

title: Rhescuporis II
text: In the meantime Tiberius returned the whole Thracian Kingdom to Tryphaena and appointed Rhoemetalces II, her eldest child with Cotys, as coruler.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV, also known as Rhescuporis IV( flourished 3rd century – died 235) was a prince and Roman Client King of the Bosporan Kingdom.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Rhescuporis IV was the second born son to the Bosporan King Cotys III and his mother was an unnamed Sarmatian noble woman.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: He was of Greek, Iranian and Roman ancestry.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: He had two brothers: one oldest called Sauromates III and a younger called Ininthimeus.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Rhescuporis IV was named in honor of his paternal uncle previous Bosporan King Rhescuporis II and his paternal cousin, previous Bosporan King Rhescuporis III, who co-ruled with his father, Rhescuporis II.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Rhescuporis IV in 233 succeeded Sauromates III after his death.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: His first brother was first co-ruler in the reign of their father Cotys III.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Rhescuporis IV was co-ruler with Cotys III, until he died in 235.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: His royal title on coins is in Greek:" ΒΑΣΙΛΕΩΣ ΡΗΣΚΟΥΠΟΡΙΔΟΣ" or" of King Rhescuporis".

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Rhescuporis IV was a contemporary to the rule of the Roman Emperor Alexander Severus.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: Little is known of the life and reign of Rhescuporis IV.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis IV
text: In 235, Rhescuporis IV was succeeded by his brother Ininthimeus.

title: Paula E. Downing
text: Paula Elaine Downing King( December 8, 1951- December 17, 2017), who wrote as Paula E. Downing, Paula King, Paula Downing King and P. K. McAllister, was an American science fiction writer.

title: Paula E. Downing
text: She published eight SF novels between 1990 and 1996.

title: Paula E. Downing
text: Her" Cloudships of Orion" trilogy of space operas features an itinerant family of Gypsies who travel through the galaxy in their spaceship in search of resources to mine.

title: Hüma Hatun
text: Hüma Hatun (1410 ‒ September 1449) was the fourth wife of Ottoman Sultan Murad II and mother of Mehmed II and the grandmother of Bayezid II.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Rhoemetalces I was king of the Odrysian kingdom of Thrace from 12 BC to 12 AD, in succession to his nephew Rhescuporis I. Rhoemetalces I was a loyal ally to the first Roman Emperor Augustus.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: He was a direct descendant of the Thracian King Cotys I, and the middle son of the earlier Thracian king Cotys IV.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: His younger brother was Rhescuporis II.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: When Cotys VII died about 48 BC Rhoemetalces became the guardian of his nephew Rhescuporis I, his brother's young son and heir.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Rhescuporis I died in 13 BC, when he was defeated and slain in battle by Vologases, chief of the Thracian Bessi, who was a leader in the revolt against the Romans in that year.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: During this revolt Rhoemetalces and his family fled

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Thrace, returning only when it ended, when Augustus returned the kingdom to his family.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: As Rhescuporis I had left no heir, Rhoemetalces became King of Thrace in 12 BC.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: The Roman Historian Tacitus, describes him as ‘ attractive and civilized ’.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: His wife and the mother of his heir, known only through numismatic evidence, was Queen Pythodoris.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Rhoemetalces I ruled Thrace until his death in 12.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Augustus then divided his realm into two separate kingdoms, one half for his son Cotys VIII to rule and the other half for Rhoemetalces's remaining brother Rhescuporis II.

title: Rhoemetalces I
text: Tacitus states that Cotys received the cultivated parts, most towns and most Greek cities of Thrace, while Rhescuporis received the wild and savage portion with enemies on its frontier.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: Rhoemetalces II was a Client Ruler in association with his mother Antonia Tryphaena of the Odrysian kingdom of Thrace under the Romans from 18 to 38.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: On coinage his royal title is in Greek: ΒΑΣΙΛΕΥΣ ΡΟΙΜΗΤΑΛΚΑΣ or of King Rhoemetalces.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: Rhoemetalces II and Tryphaena succeeded his paternal great- uncle Rhescuporis II, who had usurped the throne from Rhoemetalces II's father Cotys VIII.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: The Roman Emperor Tiberius deposed Rhescuporis II and installed Rhoemetalces II and Tryphaena on the throne in his place.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: They served as loyal client rulers, even in 26 putting down Thracian malcontents for Tiberius.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: Rhoemetalces II never married and had no children.

title: Rhoemetalces II
text: After his death in 38, his cousin Rhoemetalces III, the son of Rhescuporis II, was appointed king, while his mother retired to live as a private citizen in Cyzicus.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III Philocaesar Philoromaios Eusebes, also known as Rhescuporis III(" Philocaesar Philoromaios Eusebes", means" lover of Caesar, lover of Rome who is the Pius one", flourished 3rd century – died 227) was a prince and Roman Client King of the Bosporan Kingdom.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: Rhescuporis III was the son and heir of Bosporan King Rhescuporis II by an unnamed woman and was of Greek, Iranian and Roman ancestry.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: In 210/211 the paternal grandfather of Rhescuporis III, King Sauromates II died, Rhescuporis III succeeded with his father Rhescuporis II.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: Rhescuporis III co-ruled with his father as Bosporan Kings until their deaths in 227.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: His royal title on coins is in Greek:" ΒΑΣΙΛΕΩΣ ΡΗΣΚΟΥΠΟΡΙΔΟΣ" or" King Rhescuporis".

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: In 221, in the seaport city located in the Black Sea called Amastris( modern Amasra) there was an honorific inscription dedicated to Rhescuporis III.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: The inscription describes Rhescuporis III as: He was a contemporary to the rule of the Roman Emperors Caracalla, Macrinus, Elagabalus and Alexander Severus.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: Little is known of the life and reign of Rhescuporis III.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis III
text: In the year he and his father died, they were succeeded by Cotys III, a brother of Rhescuporis II and paternal uncle to Rhescuporis III.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II Philocaesar Philoromaios Eusebes, also known as Rhescuporis II(" Philocaesar Philoromaios Eusebes", means" lover of Caesar, lover of Rome who is the Pius one", flourished 3rd century – died 227) was a prince and Roman Client King of the Bosporan Kingdom.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis II was the first- born son to Bosporan King Sauromates II by an unnamed woman and was of Greek, Iranian and Roman ancestry.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: His brother was Cotys III.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis II was named in honor of Rhescuporis I, a paternal ancestor of his and a previous Bosporan King.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: When Sauromates II died in 210/211, Rhescuporis II succeeded his father.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: He reigned as Bosporan King until his death in 227.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: His royal title on coins is in Greek:" ΒΑΣΙΛΕΩΣ ΡΗΣΚΟΥΠΟΡΙΔΟΣ" or" of King Rhescuporis".

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: During his reign, Rhescuporis II co-ruled with his son Rhescuporis III from an unnamed wife.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: He was a contemporary to the rule of the Roman Emperors Caracalla, Macrinus, Elagabalus and Alexander Severus.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: Little is known of the life and reign of Rhescuporis II.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: In the year of his death and his son also died.

title: Tiberius Julius Rhescuporis II
text: Rhescuporis II was succeeded by Cotys III.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

title: William Asher
text: William Milton Asher( August 8, 1921 – July 16, 2012) was an American television and film producer, film director, and screenwriter.

title: William Asher
text: He was one of the most prolific early television directors, producing or directing over two dozen series.

title: William Asher
text: With television in its infancy, Asher introduced the sitcom" Our Miss Brooks", which was adapted from a radio show.

title: William Asher
text: He began directing" I Love Lucy" by 1952.

title: William Asher
text: In 1964, he produced and directed" Bewitched", which starred his then- wife Elizabeth Montgomery.

title: William Asher
text: As a result of his early success, Asher was considered an" early wunderkind of TV- land," and was hyperbolically credited in one magazine article with" inventing" the sitcom.

title: William Asher
text: Asher was nominated for an Emmy Award four times, winning once for directing" Bewitched" in 1966.

title: William Asher
text: He was also nominated for the DGA Award in 1951 for" I Love Lucy".

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker, later released as Night Warning, is a 1981 American exploitation horror film directed by William Asher, and starring Susan Tyrrell, Jimmy McNichol, Julia Duffy, and Bo Svenson.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: Framed as a contemporary Oedipus tale, the plot focuses on a teenager who, raised by his neurotic aunt, finds himself at the center of a murder investigation after she stabs a man to death in their house.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: The boy's sexually repressed aunt secretly harbors incestuous feelings for him, while a homophobic detective investigating the crime irrationally believes the murder to be a result of a homosexual love triangle.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: Financed by the independent Royal American Picture, the film was shot in Los Angeles in 1981.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: Michael Miller was originally hired to direct, and completed the filming of the opening sequence with cinematographer Jan de Bont before being fired and replaced by Asher, who shot the remainder of the film with Robbie Greenberg.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: Given a regional release in Oregon in November 1981 through Comworld Pictures, the film expanded to other U.S. cities in early 1982, and was nominated for a Saturn Award for the Best Horror Movie of 1982 by the Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror Films.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: It was reissued theatrically in 1983 under the title" Night Warning", under which it was subsequently released on home video.

title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
text: The film has attracted critical discussion for its early positive portrayal of a gay male character.

title: A Flame in My Heart
text: A Flame in My Heart is a 1987 French- Swiss drama film directed by Alain Tanner.

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: James Vincent McNichol III( born July 2, 1961), known professionally as Jimmy McNichol, is an American former child actor and singer who first gained fame as a teen idol in the late 1970s.

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: At the beginning of his career his popularity quickly grew causing networks like CBS, to create and implement multiple television series specifically for his involvement and leading roles.

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: After making a record number of appearances on top talk shows he was viewed by many as" the face you see everywhere."

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: In 1978, McNichol recorded an album with his sister, Kristy, also a former actress, and the two went on to host a youth- oriented variety show for ABC.

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: McNichol subsequently had lead roles in" Smokey Bites the Dust"( 1981), and opposite Susan Tyrrell in the horror film" Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker"( 1981).

title: Jimmy McNichol
text: After retiring from acting in the 1990s, McNichol relocated with his family to Colorado, and has been active in environmentalist causes, and working as a real estate investor and home renovator.

title: Miss Brown to You
text: "Miss Brown to You" is a song with music composed by Richard A. Whiting and Ralph Rainger, and lyrics written by Leo Robin.

title: Miss Brown to You
text: It was first recorded on July 25, 1935 by Billie Holiday accompanied by Teddy Wilson and his orchestra.

title: Miss Brown to You

title: Miss Brown to You
text: A live favourite, Holiday recorded the song many times, most notably in June, 1949 for the FRS radio broadcast, "Just Jazz" in Los Angeles with Neal Hefti on trumpet, Herbie Harper on trombone, Herbie Steward on clarinet and tenor saxophone, Jimmy Rowles on piano, Robert "Iggy" Shevak on bass, and Blinkie Garner on drums, at the Storyville Club in Boston on October 31, 1951 accompanied by Buster Harding on piano, John Field on bass, and Marquis Foster on drums, and at the Carnegie Hall, New York City, on November 10, 1956 with Her Orchestra formed by Roy Eldridge on trumpet, Coleman Hawkins on tenor saxophone, Carl Drinkard on piano, Kenny Burrell on guitar, Carson Smith on bass, and Chico Hamilton on drums.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Eleanora Fagan (April 7, 1915 – July 17, 1959), better known as Billie Holiday, was an African American jazz singer with a career spanning nearly thirty years.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Nicknamed "Lady Day" by her friend and music partner Lester Young, Holiday had a seminal influence on jazz music and pop singing.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Her vocal style, strongly inspired by jazz instrumentalists, pioneered a new way of manipulating phrasing and tempo.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She was known for her vocal delivery and improvisational skills.

title: Billie Holiday
text: After a turbulent childhood, Holiday began singing in nightclubs in Harlem, where she was heard by the producer John Hammond, who commended her voice.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She signed a recording contract with Brunswick in 1935.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Collaborations with Teddy Wilson yielded the hit "What a Little Moonlight Can Do", which became a jazz standard.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Throughout the 1930s and 1940s, Holiday had mainstream success on labels such as Columbia and Decca.

title: Billie Holiday
text: By the late 1940s, however, she was beset with legal troubles and drug abuse.

title: Billie Holiday
text: After a short prison sentence, she performed at a sold-out concert at Carnegie Hall, but her reputation deteriorated because of her drug and alcohol problems.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She was a successful concert performer throughout the 1950s with two further sold-out shows at Carnegie Hall.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Due to personal struggles and an altered voice, her final recordings were met with mixed reaction, but were mild commercial successes.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Her final album, "Lady in Satin", was released in 1958.

title: Billie Holiday
text: Holiday died of cirrhosis on July 17, 1959.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She won four Grammy Awards, all of them posthumously, for Best Historical Album.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 1973.

title: Billie Holiday
text: "Lady Sings the Blues", a film about her life, starring Diana Ross, was released in 1972.

title: Billie Holiday
text: She is the primary character in the play (later made into a film) "

title: Billie Holiday
text: Lady Day at Emerson's Bar and Grill"

title: Billie Holiday
text: ; the role was originated by Reenie Upchurch in 1986, and was played by Audra McDonald on Broadway and in the film.

title: Billie Holiday
text: In 2017 Holiday was inducted into the National Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The Kerman Seljuk Sultanate( also known as Kerman sultanate Persian: سلجوقیان کرمان Saljūqiyān- i Kerman) was a Turko- Persian Sunni Muslim state, established in the parts of Kerman and Makran which had been conquered from the Buyid dynasty by the Seljuk Empire which was established by Seljuk Turks.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The Founder of this dynasty, Emadeddin Kara Arslan Ahmad Qavurt who succeeded the ruler of this dynasty after the surrender of the ruler of Buyyids, Abu Kalijar Marzuban.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: For first time in this period, an independent state was formed in Kerman; eventually, after 150 years, with the invasion of the Ghuz leader's Malik Dinar, the Kerman Seljuk Sultanate fall.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The government is the first powerful local government in the Kerman and Makran region, which, in addition to political and security stability, could create economic prosperity in the provinces.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: It was during this period that the Spice Road burgeoned with the flourishing of the ports of Tiz, Hormuz and Kish, and this state, as the highway of this important economic road, could use tremendous wealth with the conditions it had created.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: Regarding the scientific and social conditions, at this time, with the efforts of the Shahs such as Mohammad Shah II, the scientific and cultural centers were established in Kerman, and with these actions, Kerman, which was away from the main scientific centers, became the center of science in the southeastern region of Iran's plateau.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: In addition, Kerman and Makran under ruling of Seljuk, grew in agriculture and Animal husbandry, and Progressed in Commerce and trade which led to improved economic and social conditions.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Lake Charles, Louisiana was named for Charles Sallier, an early settler of the area.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Martin and Dela LeBleu were among the first to settle near Lake Charles, in the area called LeBleu Settlement.

title: Charles Sallier
text: They arrived in Lake Charles in 1781 from Bordeaux, France, and settled approximately six miles east of present- day Lake Charles, Louisiana.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Soon after, many immigrants began arriving in the area to settle.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Among them was Charles Anselm Sallier.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Charles Sallier moved to Lake Charles and married the LeBleus' daughter, Catherine.

title: Charles Sallier
text: They settled near Lake Charles( the lake) and had six children.

title: Charles Sallier
text: As legend tells it, one day Charles Sallier thought that Catherine was having an affair with Jean Laffite.

title: Charles Sallier
text: In rage, he shot at his wife and assumed she was dead.

title: Charles Sallier
text: In guilt and regret, Charles ran off.

title: Charles Sallier
text: However, Catherine had survived the shot by only a simple piece of jewelry – her brooch.

title: Charles Sallier
text: She continued her life raising the six children in Lake Charles.

title: Charles Sallier

title: Arcata–Eureka Airport

title: Arcata–Eureka Airport
text: The National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems for 2011 – 2015 categorized it as a" Nonhub primary commercial service" airport.

title: Arcata–Eureka Airport

title: Arcata–Eureka Airport

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: Lake Charles Regional Airport is a public use airport located five nautical miles( 9 km) south of the central business district of Lake Charles, a city in Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, United States.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: Owned by Calcasieu Parish, the airport serves approximately 375,000 people in the Lake Charles – Jennings combined statistical area.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: They are oriented 5/23 and 15/33 and do not cross.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: The grounds are bounded by Lake Street to the West, Gauthier Road to the North, Highway 385 to the East, and Lincoln Road to the South.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: The entrance is off of Highway 385.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: A new modern terminal building was officially opened to the public in 2009.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport
text: Built in the Louisiana plantation architectural style, it is a two- story terminal with one concourse.

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport

title: Lake Charles Regional Airport

title: Elmira Corning Regional Airport
