title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Judy Garland
text: Judy Garland (born Frances Ethel Gumm; June 10, 1922 – June 22, 1969) was an American actress, singer and dancer.

title: Judy Garland
text: During a career that spanned 45 years, she attained international stardom as an actress in both musical and dramatic roles, as a recording artist, and on the concert stage.

title: Judy Garland
text: Respected for her versatility, she received an Academy Juvenile Award, a Golden Globe Award, and a Special Tony Award.

title: Judy Garland
text: In 1962, Garland won the Grammy Award for Album of the Year for her 1961 double LP live recording "Judy at Carnegie Hall"—the first woman to win in this category.

title: Judy Garland
text: She is considered by many to be one of the greatest artists of the 20th Century.

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland began performing in vaudeville as a child with her two elder sisters and was later signed to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer as a teenager.

title: Judy Garland
text: She appeared in more than two dozen films for MGM, and is best remembered for her portrayal of Dorothy Gale in "The Wizard of Oz" (1939).

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland was a frequent on-screen partner of both Mickey Rooney and Gene Kelly and regularly collaborated with director and second husband Vincente Minnelli.

title: Judy Garland
text: Some of her film appearances during this period include roles in "Meet Me in St. Louis" (1944), "The Harvey Girls" (1946), "Easter Parade" (1948), and "Summer Stock" (1950).

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland was released from MGM in 1950, after 15 years with the studio, amid a series of personal struggles that prevented her from fulfilling the terms of her contract.

title: Judy Garland
text: Although her film career became intermittent thereafter, two of Garland's most critically acclaimed performances came late in her career: she received a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance in "A Star Is Born" (1954) and a nomination for Best Supporting Actress for her role in "Judgment at Nuremberg" (1961).

title: Judy Garland
text: She also made record-breaking concert appearances, released eight studio albums, and hosted her own Emmy-nominated television series,

title: Judy Garland
text: "The Judy Garland Show" (1963–1964).

title: Judy Garland
text: At age 39, Garland became the youngest and first female recipient of the Cecil B. DeMille Award for lifetime achievement in the film industry.

title: Judy Garland
text: In 1997, Garland was posthumously awarded a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award.

title: Judy Garland
text: Several of her recordings have been inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame, and in 1999, the American Film Institute placed her among the 10 greatest female stars of classic American cinema.

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland struggled in her personal life from an early age.

title: Judy Garland
text: The pressures of early stardom affected her physical and mental health from her teens onward; her self-image was influenced and constantly criticized by film executives who believed that she was physically unattractive.

title: Judy Garland
text: Those same executives manipulated her onscreen physical appearance.

title: Judy Garland
text: Throughout her adulthood she was plagued by alcohol and substance abuse, as well as financial instability; she often owed hundreds of thousands of dollars in back taxes.

title: Judy Garland
text: Her lifelong addiction to drugs, including alcohol, ultimately led to her death in London from an accidental barbiturate overdose at age 47.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow (Cailin Deas Crúite na mBó in the Irish language) is a traditional 18th-century Irish ballad.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The English version is attributed to Thomas Moore (1779–1852).

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Originally sung in Irish Gaelic, the song was popular through the early 20th century.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It enjoyed a revival when an updated swing version sung by Irish-American singer/actress Judy Garland was featured in the 1940 film Little Nellie Kelly.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The updated version is true to the original musical air, and incorporated original lyrics by MGM Musical Director Roger Edens, and featured Garland singing the song to George Murphy using some of the original Gaelic lyrics in the first chorus, which was true to the traditional air, before moving into an up-tempo swing version typical of the era.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The song was released as the B-side of the more popular Garland song

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It's A Great Day for the Irish by Decca Records in 1940.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It became a popular song for Irish-Americans during St Patrick's Day celebrations.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It remained a popular number for Garland throughout her career, and most notably she sang it live in its original Irish language version in July 1951 at her Theatre Royal concerts in Dublin, Ireland.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: A Dublin review stated: "Remember the song she sang in "Nellie KellyThe Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow."

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Judy is providing herself with the Irish version – "Cailin Deas Cruidte na mBo" while in Ireland".

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Later in 1951, she included the song in her first record-breaking appearance at New York's Palace Theatre, although this time reverting to the new version that combined both English- and Irish-language lyrics.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The song is also featured on Garland at the Grove on Capitol Records, recorded live in 1958 at the Coconut Grove in Hollywood.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Singers and groups including Bing Crosby, Ruby Murray, Eileen Barton, Carmel Quinn, Clannad, The Fureys, Blackthorn Ceilidh Band, Runa and The Chieftains, Altan among others, have recorded the song in either form or a combination of both.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Duck Baker recorded a fingerstyle guitar arrangement.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The song was sung by Jack Jones the teenage son of Anne Jones the publican of the Glenrowan Inn

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: (Victoria, Australia) while it was under siege by the Kelly Gang.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The siege was broken by the Victorian Police on the morning of Monday June 28, 1880.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Jack Jones died of injuries sustained during the police assault on the hotel.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: This song was cover-versioned by Japanese singer Suzuki Tsunekichi (Japanese: 鈴木常吉) in the title of "Memories" (Japanese: 思ひで), which was adapted as the opening theme song of Japanese TV drama "Shinya Shokudō"(Japanese: 深夜食堂).

title: Samalá River
text: The Samalá is a river in southwestern Guatemala.

title: Samalá River
text: Its sources are in the Sierra Madre, Valle De Écija range, in the departments of Quetzaltenango and Totonicapán.

title: Samalá River
text: From there it flows down, past the towns San Carlos Sija in the Valle De Écija, Quetzaltenango, San Cristóbal Totonicapán, Quetzaltenango, El Palmar and Zunil, through the coastal plains of Retalhuleu into the Pacific Ocean.

title: Samalá River
text: The Samalá river basin covers a territory of and has a population of around 400,000 people.

title: Samalá River
text: Its proximity to the active Santa Maria and Santiaguito volcano complex, with its recurring lava and lahars flows, leads to a heightened risk of serious flooding.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: K. Raghavendra Rao( born Kovelamudi Raghavendra Rao on 23 May 1942) is an Indian film director, producer, screenwriter and choreographer, known for his works predominantly in Telugu cinema and a few Hindi and Kannada films.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: He has garnered eight state Nandi Awards, the IIFA Award, the SIIMA Award, five Filmfare Awards South and two Cine MAA Awards.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: In a film career spanning more than five decades, Rao has directed more than a hundred feature films, of which around ninety were box office hits, across multiple genres such as romantic comedy, fantasy, melodrama, action thriller, biographical and romance films.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao received the state Nandi Award for Best Director for his works such as" Bobbili Brahmanna"( 1984), and" Pelli Sandadi"( 1996).

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: He garnered the Filmfare Award for Best Director – Telugu for the drama film" Prema Lekhalu"( 1977), the super natural fantasy film," Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari"( 1990), and the romance film" Allari Priyudu"( 1993).

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao is known for his works in hagiographical films such as" Annamayya"( 1997), which won two National Film Awards, and was also showcased at the 1998 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao also received the Nandi Award for Best Direction, the Filmfare Award for Best Direction for his work in the film.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: His other hagiographic works such as" Sri Manjunatha"( 2001)," Sri Ramadasu"( 2006)," Shirdi Sai"( 2012) and" Om Namo Venkatesaya"( 2017), received several state honors.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: His mainstream works such as the 1987 Social problem film" Agni Putrudu", and the 1988 action thriller" Aakhari Poratam", were screened at the 11th and 12th International Film Festival of India respectively in the mainstream section.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: In 1992, he directed the melodrama" Gharana Mogudu", premiered at the 1993 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section, which became the first Telugu film to gross over 10 crore at the box office.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Next, he directed the instant hit" Allari Priyudu", which was also premiered at the 1994 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section.

title: The Actors
text: The Actors is a 2003 film written and directed by Conor McPherson and starring Dylan Moran and Michael Caine.

title: The Actors
text: In supporting roles are Michael Gambon, Miranda Richardson and Lena Headey.

title: The Actors
text: " The Actors" is a contemporary comedy set in Dublin.

title: The Actors
text: It follows the exploits of two mediocre stage actors as they devise a plan to con a retired gangster out of £ 50,000.

title: The Actors
text: The gangster owes the money to a third party, whom he has never met.

title: The Actors
text: The actors take advantage of this fact by impersonating this' unidentified' third party, and claiming the debt as their own.

title: The Actors
text: To pull it off they enlist Moran's eerily intelligent nine- year- old niece, who restructures the plan each time something goes wrong.

title: The Actors
text: The two protagonists are acting in a version of Shakespeare's" Richard III" in which everyone dresses in Nazi uniform, a sly nod to Ian McKellen's production.

title: The Actors
text: The film is centred on the Olympia Theatre, and it is noteworthy for featuring the famous glass awning over the entrance which has since been destroyed in a traffic accident.

title: The Actors
text: The glass awning has since been rebuilt to its full former glory.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Van Morrison
text: Sir George Ivan "Van" Morrison (born 31 August 1945) is a Northern Irish singer- songwriter, instrumentalist and record producer.

title: Van Morrison
text: His professional career began as a teenager in the late 1950s playing a variety of instruments including guitar, harmonica, keyboards and saxophone for various Irish showbands, covering the popular hits of that time.

title: Van Morrison
text: Van Morrison rose to prominence in the mid-1960s as the lead singer of the Northern Irish R&B band Them, with whom he recorded the garage band classic "Gloria".

title: Van Morrison
text: His solo career began under the pop-hit oriented guidance of Bert Berns with the release of the hit single "Brown Eyed Girl" in 1967.

title: Van Morrison
text: After Berns's death, Warner Bros. Records bought out his contract and allowed him three sessions to record "Astral Weeks" (1968).

title: Van Morrison
text: Though this album gradually garnered high praise, it was initially a poor seller.

title: Van Morrison
text: Van Morrison has a reputation for being at once stubborn, idiosyncratic, and sublime.

title: Van Morrison
text: His live performances at their best are seen as transcendental and inspired; while many of his recordings, such as the studio albums "Astral Weeks" and "Moondance", and the live album "

title: Van Morrison
text: It's Too Late to Stop Now", are acclaimed.

title: Van Morrison
text: "Moondance" (1970) established Morrison as a major artist, and he built on his reputation throughout the 1970s with a series of acclaimed albums and live performances.

title: Van Morrison
text: He continues to record and tour, producing albums and live performances that sell well and are generally warmly received, sometimes collaborating with other artists, such as Georgie Fame and The Chieftains.

title: Van Morrison
text: Much of Morrison's music is structured around the conventions of soul music and R&B, such as the popular singles "

title: Van Morrison
text: Brown Eyed GirlJackie Wilson Said (I'm in Heaven

title: Van Morrison
text: When You Smile)Domino" and "Wild Night".

title: Van Morrison
text: An equal part of his catalogue consists of lengthy, loosely connected, spiritually inspired musical journeys that show the influence of Celtic tradition, jazz and stream-of-consciousness narrative, such as the album "Astral Weeks" and the lesser known "Veedon Fleece" and "Common One".

title: Van Morrison
text: The two strains together are sometimes referred to as "Celtic soul".

title: Van Morrison
text: He has received two Grammy Awards, the 1994 Brit Award for Outstanding Contribution to Music, the 2017 Americana Music Lifetime Achievement Award for Songwriting and has been inducted into both the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

title: Van Morrison
text: In 2016, he was knighted for services to the music industry and to tourism in Northern Ireland.

title: Van Morrison
text: He is known by the nickname

title: Van Morrison
text: Van the Man to his fans.

title: Inferno (2016 film)

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film is the sequel to" The Da Vinci Code"( 2006) and" Angels& Demons"( 2009), and is the third and final installment in the" Robert Langdon" film series.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: It stars Tom Hanks, reprising his role as Robert Langdon, alongside Felicity Jones, Omar Sy, Sidse Babett Knudsen, Ben Foster, and Irrfan Khan.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: Filming began on April 27, 2015, in Venice, Italy, and wrapped on July 21, 2015, in Budapest.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film premiered in Florence on October 9, 2016, and was released in the United States on October 28, 2016, ten years after release of" The Da Vinci Code", in 2D and IMAX formats.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film received generally negative reviews from critics, but grossed$ 220 million against a production budget of$ 75 million.

text: The Solfilmen is a weather program, broadcast on 21:24 UTC+ 1 every Friday on SVT2( as a part of the news program" Aktuellt") from the first Friday after Kiruna's first sunrise of the year to Midsummer.

title: Solfilmen

title: Solfilmen

title: Solfilmen

title: Solfilmen

title: Solfilmen

title: Uvanga

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Carnival of Souls is a 1962 American independent horror film written, produced, and directed by Herk Harvey, and starring Candace Hilligoss.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Its plot follows Mary Henry, a young woman whose life is disturbed after a car accident.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: She relocates to a new city, where she finds herself unable to assimilate with the locals, and becomes drawn to the pavilion of an abandoned carnival; director Harvey also appears in the film as a ghoulish stranger who stalks her throughout.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Filmed in Lawrence, Kansas and Salt Lake City, "Carnival of Souls" was shot on a budget of $33,000, and Harvey employed various guerrilla filmmaking techniques to finish the production.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: It was Harvey's only feature film, and did not gain widespread attention when originally released as a double feature with "The Devil's Messenger" in 1962.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Set to an organ score by Gene Moore, the film has been contemporarily noted by critics and film scholars for its cinematography and foreboding atmosphere.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: The film has a large cult following and is occasionally screened at film and Halloween festivals, and has been cited as a wide-ranging influence on numerous filmmakers, including David Lynch, George A. Romero and even Argentine auteur Lucrecia Martel.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Bahadur Shah Zafar or Bahadur Shah II (born as Mirza Abu Zafar Siraj-ud-din Muhammad) (24 October 1775 – 7 November 1862) was the last Mughal emperor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: He was the second son of and became the successor to his father, Akbar II, upon his death on 28 September 1837.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: He was a nominal Emperor, as the Mughal Empire existed in name only and his authority was limited only to the walled city of Old Delhi (Shahjahanbad).

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Following his involvement in the Indian Rebellion of 1857, the British exiled him to Rangoon in British-controlled Burma (now in Myanmar), after convicting him on several charges.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Zafar's father, Akbar II had been imprisoned by the British and he was not his father's preferred choice as his successor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: One of Akbar Shah's queens, Mumtaz Begum, pressured him to declare her son, Mirza Jahangir, as his successor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: However, The East India Company exiled Jahangir after he attacked their resident, in the Red Fort, paving the way for Zafar to assume the throne.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born.

title: Place of birth
text: This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live.

title: Place of birth
text: If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947.

title: Place of birth
text: This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth".

title: Place of birth
text: It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

text: Socrates (– 399 BC) was a classical Greek (Athenian) philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy, and as being the first moral philosopher of the Western ethical tradition of thought.

title: Socrates
text: An enigmatic figure, he made no writings, and is known chiefly through the accounts of classical writers writing after his lifetime, particularly his students Plato and Xenophon.

title: Socrates
text: Other sources include the contemporaneous Antisthenes, Aristippus, and Aeschines of Sphettos.

title: Socrates
text: Aristophanes, a playwright, is the main contemporary author to have written plays mentioning Socrates during Socrates' lifetime, though a fragment of Ion of Chios' "Travel Journal" provides important information about Socrates' youth.

title: Socrates
text: Plato's dialogues are among the most comprehensive accounts of Socrates to survive from antiquity, from which Socrates has become renowned for his contributions to the fields of ethics and epistemology.

title: Socrates
text: It is this who lends his name to the concepts of Socratic irony and the Socratic method, or "elenchus."

title: Socrates
text: However, questions remain regarding the distinction between the real-life Socrates and Plato's portrayal of Socrates in his dialogues.

title: Socrates
text: Socrates exerted a strong influence on philosophers in later antiquity and in the modern era.

title: Socrates
text: Depictions of Socrates in art, literature and popular culture have made him one of the most widely known figures in the Western philosophical tradition.

title: Where Was I
text: " Where Was I?" may refer to:

title: Beaulieu-sur-Loire
text: Beaulieu- sur- Loire is a commune in the Loiret department in north -central France.

title: Beaulieu-sur-Loire
text: It is also the place of death of Jacques MacDonald, a French general who served in the Napoleonic Wars

title: Valley of Death
text: Valley of Death may refer to:

title: Dance of Death (disambiguation)
text: Dance of Death, also called" Danse Macabre", is a late- medieval allegory of the universality of death.

title: Dance of Death (disambiguation)
text: Dance of Death or The Dance of Death may also refer to:

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born.

title: Place of birth
text: This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live.

title: Place of birth
text: If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947.

title: Place of birth
text: This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth".

title: Place of birth
text: It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: Sennedjem
text: The Ancient Egyptian artisan Sennedjem lived in Set Maat( translated as" The Place of Truth"), contemporary Deir el- Medina, on the west bank of the Nile, opposite Thebes, during the reigns of Seti I and Ramesses II.

title: Sennedjem
text: Sennedjem had the title" Servant in the Place of Truth".

title: Sennedjem
text: He was buried along with his wife, Iyneferti, and family in a tomb in the village necropolis.

title: Sennedjem
text: His tomb was discovered January 31, 1886.

title: Sennedjem
text: When Sennedjem's tomb was found, in it there was regular furniture from his home, including a stool and a bed, which he actually used when he was alive.

title: Sennedjem
text: His titles included Servant in the Place of Truth, meaning that he worked on the excavation and decoration of the nearby royal tombs.

title: Lamprocles
text: Lamprocles was Socrates' and Xanthippe's eldest son.

title: Lamprocles
text: His two brothers were Menexenus and Sophroniscus.

title: Lamprocles
text: Lamprocles was only a boy (μειράκιον "meirakion") at the time of Socrates' trial and death.

title: Lamprocles
text: According to Aristotle, Socrates' descendants as a whole turned out to be unremarkable "fools and dullards".

text: Lima Barreto (23 June 1906 – 23 November 1982) was a Brazilian film director and screenwriter.

title: Lima Barreto (director)
text: He directed six films between 1940 and 1961.

title: Lima Barreto (director)
text: His film "O Cangaceiro" was entered into the 1953 Cannes Film Festival, where it was "much liked for its original and truly national flavour."

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer

text: What is Funny?,

text: What is Right?,

text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

text: He competed at the 1992 World Championships and finished 31st.

text: Following his retirement from competitive skating, he became a coach and choreographer.

title: Kim Se-yol
text: Among his current and former students are Lee Kyu -hyun, Kim Yuna, and Lee Dong- whun.

title: J. Lee
text: J. Lee( sometimes credited as J Lee) is an American actor, writer and occasional musician known for playing Lt. John LaMarr on the Fox science fiction comedy television series" The Orville".

title: Euna Lee
text: Euna Lee( Hangul: 리유나)( born 1972) is a Korean American journalist who has worked for Current TV since 2005.

title: Euna Lee
text: Lee and fellow journalist Laura Ling were detained in North Korea after they crossed into the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from the People's Republic of China without a visa.

title: Euna Lee
text: They were found guilty of illegal entry and sentenced to twelve years' hard labor in June 2009.

title: Euna Lee
text: The United States Government protested the sentences, and implemented diplomatic efforts in order to secure the release of both Lee and Ling.

title: Euna Lee
text: On 4 August 2009 Lee and Ling were pardoned by the North Korean government after a special humanitarian visit by former U.S. President Bill Clinton.

title: Euna Lee
text: Lee was born and raised in South Korea, and moved to the United States in order to attend Academy of Art University, where she received a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Film and Broadcasting.

title: Euna Lee
text: She graduated from the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism in 2012.

title: Euna Lee
text: She is married to actor Michael Saldate; they have a daughter, Hana.

title: Euna Lee
text: On 4 August 2009, former US President Bill Clinton visited North Korea in an attempt to free Lee and fellow journalist Laura Ling.

title: Euna Lee
text: The North Korean government pardoned both Lee and Ling after meeting with Clinton that day.

title: Euna Lee
text: Human rights activists in South Korea accused Lee and Ling of placing North Korean refugees in danger through their actions.

title: Euna Lee
text: In 2011, Lee and Ling received the McGill Medal for Journalistic Courage from the Grady College of Journalism and Mass Communication.

title: The Art of Woo
text: The Art of Woo is a 2001 Canadian romantic comedy film written and directed by Helen Lee and starring Sook- Yin Lee and Adam Beach.

title: Pete Carril
text: Peter Joseph Carril( born July 10, 1930) is an American former basketball coach.

title: Pete Carril
text: He is best known for his time as head coach of Princeton University for 30 years and his use of the' Princeton offense'.

title: Pete Carril
text: He also coached at Lehigh University and in the NBA as an assistant with the Sacramento Kings.

title: Sydney Smith Lee
text: Sydney Smith Lee( September 2, 1802 – July 22, 1869), called Smith Lee in his lifetime, was an American naval officer who served as a captain in the Confederate States Navy during the American Civil War.

title: Sydney Smith Lee
text: He was the third child of Henry" Light Horse Harry" Lee and Anne Hill Carter Lee, and the older brother of Confederate general Robert E. Lee.

title: Godwin Davy
text: Godwin Davy( born 15 December 1979) is an Anguillan international footballer who plays as a goalkeeper.

title: Godwin Davy
text: He made his international debut in a World Cup qualifying match against El Salvador, resulting in a lopsided match, losing 12- 0 in February 2008, and also played in the 4 – 0 loss to the same country in the return match in March 2008.

title: Lee and Herring
text: Lee and Herring were a British standup comedy double act consisting of the comedians Stewart Lee and Richard Herring.

title: Lee and Herring
text: They were most famous for their work on television, most notably" Fist of Fun" and" This Morning with Richard Not Judy" but had been working together on stage and on radio since the late 1980s.

title: Lee and Herring
text: As with many double acts, Lee and Herring performed as contrasting personalities: one mature and duplicitous( Lee) and the other puerile and cheeky( Herring).

title: Lee and Herring
text: As with several other double acts, Lee and Herring had a certain irony to their style and constantly checked themselves and made reference to this.

title: Lee and Herring
text: The characters of Lee and Herring were parodies and exaggerations of their real life selves.

title: Lee and Herring
text: In 2011, Frank Skinner cited Lee and Herring as one of his favourite comedy double acts, alongside Laurel and Hardy, The Two Ronnies and Reeves and Mortimer.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Ashes and Diamonds( Polish: Popiół i diament) is a 1958 Polish drama film directed by Andrzej Wajda, based on the 1948 novel by Polish writer Jerzy Andrzejewski.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Starring Zbigniew Cybulski and Ewa Krzyżewska, it completed Wajda's war films trilogy, following" A Generation"( 1954) and" Kanal"( 1956).

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The action of" Ashes and Diamonds" takes place in 1945, shortly after World War II.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The main protagonist of the film, former Home Army soldier Maciek Chełmicki, is acting in the anti-Communist underground.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Maciek receives an order to kill Szczuka, the local secretary of the Polish Workers' Party.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Over time, Chełmicki increasingly doubts if his task is worth doing.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: " Ashes and Diamonds", although based on the novel which directly supported the postwar Communist system in Poland, was subtly modified in comparison with the source material.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Wajda sympathized with the soldiers of the Polish independence underground; thus, he devoted most of the attention to Chełmicki.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: During the three- month development of" Ashes and Diamonds", the director made drastic changes to the baseline scenario, thanks to his assistant director Janusz Morgenstern, as well as Cybulski, who played the leading role.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The film received permission from the authorities to be distributed only through Andrzejewski's intercession.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The film did not receive permission to be screened at the main competition at the Cannes Film Festival.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: However," Ashes and Diamonds" appeared at the Venice Film Festival, where it won the FIPRESCI award.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: At first," Ashes and Diamonds" met positive critical reception, both in Poland and worldwide.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: However, after the Revolutions of 1989, it was criticized for falsifying the collective memory of Polish partisans.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Nevertheless, the film maintained the reputation of one of the most famous Polish motion pictures in history.

title: Michael Govan
text: Michael Govan( born 1963) is the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art since 2006.

title: Michael Govan
text: Prior to this, Govan worked as the director of the Dia Art Foundation in New York City.

title: Harald Reinl
text: Harald Reinl (8 July 1908 in Bad Ischl, Austria – 9 October 1986 in Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain) was an Austrian film director.

title: Harald Reinl
text: He is known for the films he made based on Edgar Wallace and Karl May books (see

title: Harald Reinl
text: Karl May movies and Edgar Wallace movies) and also made mountain films, Heimatfilms, German war films and entries in such popular German film series as "Dr. MabuseJerry Cotton" and "Kommissar X".

title: Harald Reinl
text: Reinl began his career as an extra in the mountain films of Arnold Fanck.

title: Harald Reinl
text: He worked as screenwriter on the film "Tiefland" directed by and starring Leni Riefenstahl.

title: Harald Reinl
text: Reinl's first movie as director was the mountain film "Mountain Crystal" (1949).

title: Harald Reinl
text: He was Oscar nominated for his documentary feature "Chariots of the Gods" (1970).

title: Harald Reinl
text: By the 1970s, he had semi-retired to the Canary Islands.

title: Harald Reinl
text: In 1986, in his Tenerife retirement home, he was stabbed to death by Daniela Maria Delis, his alcoholic wife and a former actress from Czechoslovakia.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: Eclipse of Reason is a 1987 anti-abortion documentary video directed, filmed, and narrated by Bernard Nathanson, with an introduction by Charlton Heston. "

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: Eclipse of Reason" is a follow up to Nathanson’s first film "The Silent Scream".

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: The film is perhaps most known for its controversial depiction of a dilation and evacuation (D&E) abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: The subject matter of this film focuses more on the moral implications of abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: It served as Nathanson’s call to the women of the world to end the practice of abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: This film, as well as "The Silent Scream", was instrumental in the Right to Life Committee's garnering the attention of the United States public regarding the issue of abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: "Eclipse of Reason" represented the argument that the fetus is human, and therefore abortion is murder.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: The film also serves to combat critics to "The Silent Scream" who argue that, although Nathanson claimed the film relied only on imagery and not pejorative speech, the film was heavily reliant on upon the language of the narrator.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: Therefore, "Eclipse of Reason" delivers the same message that abortion is murder, with similar imagery as its predecessor "The Silent Scream"; however, to avoid the previous appropriation of language over imagery "Eclipse of Reason" asks it viewers to consider reason rather than using emotionally charged narration.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer

text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

text: When Father Was Away on Business( Отац на службеном путу) is a 1985 Yugoslav film by director Emir Kusturica.

title: When Father Was Away on Business
text: Set in post- World War II Yugoslavia during the Informbiro period, the film tells the story from the perspective of a boy, Malik, whose father Meša( Miki Manojlović) was sent to a labour camp.

title: When Father Was Away on Business

title: David Ji
text: David Longfen Ji is an American businessman who co-founded Apex Digital, an electronics manufacturer.

title: David Ji
text: In 2004, he was arrested in China following a dispute with Sichuan Changhong Electric, a supplier owned by the city of Mianyang and the province of Sichuan.

title: David Ji
text: Changhong accused him of defrauding them through bad checks.

title: David Ji
text: Ji was taken, according to an account by his lawyer, to the senior management and told, "I decide whether you live or die."

title: David Ji
text: He has been held in China without charges.

title: David Ji
text: Ji's case highlighted an "implicit racism" in dealings with American businessmen.

title: David Ji
text: As a U.S. citizen he was not granted the same treatment by authorities as non-ethnically Chinese businessmen sharing the same nationality.

title: John Agoglia
text: John Joseph Agoglia (September 24, 1937 – March 14, 2014) was an American television executive noted for his work at NBC from 1980 to 1998, including a tenure as President of NBC Enterprises.

title: John Agoglia
text: He was considered one of the network's top negotiators, often heading complicated negotiations between NBC and producers, actors and television studios.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia was instrumental in the decision to replace Johnny Carson, the departing host of "The Tonight Show", with Jay Leno in 1992.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia was born in Brooklyn, New York.

title: John Agoglia
text: His career began at Barclays Bank, before switching to the television industry.

title: John Agoglia
text: He worked as an executive at CBS for sixteen years before joining rival NBC in 1980.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia moved to southern California permanently when he took the position at NBC.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia worked directly under a string of well-known Presidents of NBC Entertainment and other executives, including Brandon Tartikoff, Warren Littlefield and Don Ohlmeyer.

title: John Agoglia
text: He earned a reputation as one of the network's toughest dealmakers.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia led the often drawn-out negotiations with outside television studios and on-air talent.

title: John Agoglia
text: For example, Agoglia hammered out a deal with Paramount Studios for the renewal of "Cheers".

title: John Agoglia
text: He also negotiated the agreement to retain three cast members of Seinfeld - Jason Alexander, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, and Michael Richards - when each actor was demanding one million dollars per episode at the peak of the show's popularity.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia played a significant role in the decision by NBC to name Jay Leno as the host of "The Tonight Show" over David Letterman in 1992.

title: John Agoglia
text: The move sparked controversy, as Letterman jumped to CBS after Leno's appointment.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia's role in choosing Leno as Johnny Carson's successor was noted in the 1994 book, "The Late Shift", by "New York Times" journalist, Bill Carter.

title: John Agoglia
text: An HBO film adaptation of the book, "The Late Shift", aired in 1996.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia was portrayed by actor Reni Santoni in the film.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia led a multi-network 1993 boycott of the Emmy Awards, following a decision by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences to air the awards exclusively on ABC.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Emmys had previously broadcast on the television networks on a rotating basis.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia denounced the exclusivity agreement between ABC and the Emmys as "bizarre at best" and retaliated by boycott all Academy events, including the Primetime Emmy Awards.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Academy and the Emmys, under pressure from Agoglia's boycott, eventually relented and cancelled the deal with ABC.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Emmys returned to the previous agreement, in which the award show was broadcast on each of the four broadcast networks on a rotating basic each year.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia rejoined the executive committee of the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences in 1994 after the deal with ABC was ended.

title: John Agoglia
text: On June 17, 1997, Agoglia announced his decision to retire from NBC.

title: John Agoglia
text: He left NBC in 1998 after eighteen years with the network.

title: John Agoglia
text: During his retirement Agoglia launched a Media Consulting firm; served as President of the Board of LAX Airport Commission; Served on board of directors of KCET Los Angeles; and was board chairman of the Los Angeles Universal Preschool Program.

title: John Agoglia
text: John Agoglia died on March 14, 2014, at the age of 76 following a three-year illness with cancer.

title: John Agoglia
text: He was survived by his sons, Anthony and John Steven, three grandchildren, and his brother, Thomas Agoglia.

title: John Agoglia
text: His wife, Joanne Agoglia, died in 2010.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: Beshr ibn Hasan( Arabic: بشر بن حسن) was a great- grandson of Muhammad.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: He was the son of second Shia Imam Hasan ibn Ali.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: He is considered to be one of the martyrs of the Battle of Karbala, although no record describes the circumstances surrounding his death by enemy forces.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: The first instance of Beshr ibn Hasan to be listed among the martyrs of Karbala was by Shia scholar Ibn Shahrashub.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: Of Hasan ibn Ali's twenty sons, seven participated in the battle, among them Beshr ibn Hasan.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: All but one brother was killed during the battle.

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: In his account of their deaths, Shahrashub writes on Beshr:" ... and it has been said that Beshr has been martyred, too."

title: Beshr ibn Hasan
text: Among Beshr ibn Hasan's brothers who were present at the event of Ashura were Amrobne Hasan( who was killed in the event at Karbala when he was a child), Hasan ibn Hasan( who was famously known as' Hasan Muthanna'), Qasim ibn Hasan( who was also considered to be one of the martyrs of Karbala), Abdullah ibn Hasan( Abdullah Asghar).

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib (624–670 CE), sometimes spelled Hasan or Hassan, was the eldest son of Ali and Muhammad's daughter Fatimah, and was the older brother of Husayn.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: Muslims respect him as a grandson of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: Among Shia Muslims, Hasan is revered as the second Imam.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: Hasan was elected for the caliphate after his father's death, but abdicated after six or seven months to Muawiyah I, the founder of the Umayyad dynasty to end the First Fitna.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: Al-Hasan was known for donating to the poor, his kindness to the poor and bondmen, and for his knowledge, tolerance and bravery.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: For the rest of his life, Hasan lived in Medina, until he died at the age of 45 and was buried in the Jannat al-Baqi cemetery in Medina.

title: Hasan ibn Ali
text: His wife, Ja'da bint al-Ash'at, is commonly accused of having poisoned him.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Abdullah ibn Unais was a companion( Sahaba) of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: He participated in several military campaigns ordered by Muhammad.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: The first was to kill Khaled bin Sufyan Al- Hathali who belonged to the Banu Lahyan tribe at the time of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Muhammad alleged that he was planning on attacking Madinah and inciting the people of Nakhla and Uranah to attack him.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Therefore he sent Abdullah ibn Unais to assassinate him in 625 during the Expedition of Abdullah Ibn Unais.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Abdullah ibn Unais found Hudayr in the company of his wife, when asked about his identity.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Unais replied:" I am an arab tribesman who has heard of you and the Army you are raising to fight Muhammad, so i have come to join your ranks"

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Then Muhammad sent him on the Expedition of Al Raji.

title: Abdullah ibn Unais
text: Some men requested that Muhammad send instructors to teach them Islam, but the men were bribed by the two tribes of Khuzaymah who wanted revenge for the assassination of Khalid bin Sufyan by Muhammad's followers

text: Screenwriter Thomas was disturbed that MGM changed the title from the original" The Old Soak," to the" Good Old Soak."

title: The Good Old Soak
text: MGM did that because it felt Wallace Beery's fans considered the word" good" synonymous with Beery.

title: The Good Old Soak
text: Rollin Kirby, a distinguished political cartoonist on the" New York World" newspaper, and good friend of Don Marquis, got a laugh from Marquis when he suggested how appropriate it was that a man named Beery would portray the Old Soak himself.

text: Jeffrey Jacob Abrams( born June 27, 1966), known professionally as J. J. Abrams, is an American filmmaker.

title: J. J. Abrams
text: He is known for his work in the genres of action, drama, and science fiction.

title: J. J. Abrams
text: Abrams wrote or produced such films as" Regarding Henry"( 1991)," Forever Young"( 1992)," Armageddon"( 1998)," Cloverfield"( 2008)," Star Trek"( 2009),( 2015), and( 2019).

title: J. J. Abrams
text: Abrams has created numerous television series, including" Felicity"( co-creator, 1998 – 2002)," Alias"( creator, 2001 – 2006)," Lost"( co-creator, 2004 – 2010), and" Fringe"( co-creator, 2008 – 2013).

title: J. J. Abrams
text: He won two Emmy Awards for" Lost" — Outstanding Directing for a Drama Series and Outstanding Drama Series.

title: J. J. Abrams
text: His directorial film work includes( 2006)," Star Trek"( 2009)," Super 8"( 2011), and" Star Trek Into Darkness"( 2013).

title: J. J. Abrams
text: He also directed, produced and co-wrote" The Force Awakens", the seventh episode of the" Star Wars" saga and the first film of the sequel trilogy.

title: J. J. Abrams
text: The film is his highest- grossing, as well as the fourth- highest- grossing film of all time not adjusted for inflation.

title: J. J. Abrams
text: He returned to" Star Wars" by co-writing, producing and directing the ninth and final installment of the saga," The Rise of Skywalker".

title: J. J. Abrams
text: Abrams's frequent collaborators include producer Bryan Burk, producer/ director Tommy Gormley, actors Greg Grunberg, Simon Pegg and Keri Russell, composer Michael Giacchino, writers Alex Kurtzman and Roberto Orci, cinematographers Daniel Mindel and Larry Fong, and editors Maryann Brandon and Mary Jo Markey.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Rumbold of Mechelen

title: Yash Chopra
text: Yash Raj Chopra (27 September 1932 – 21 October 2012) was an Indian director and film producer who worked in Hindi films.

title: Yash Chopra
text: The founding chairman of the film production and distribution company Yash Raj Films, Chopra was the recipient of several awards, including six National Film Awards and 11 Filmfare Awards.

title: Yash Chopra
text: He is considered among the best Indian filmmakers.

title: Yash Chopra
text: For his contributions to film, the Government of India honoured him with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 2001, and the Padma Bhushan in 2005.

title: Yash Chopra
text: British Academy of Film and Television Arts presented him with a lifetime membership, making him the first Indian to receive the honour.

title: Yash Chopra
text: Chopra began his career as an assistant director to I. S. Johar and his elder brother, B.R. Chopra.

title: Yash Chopra
text: He made directorial debut with "Dhool Ka Phool" in 1959, a melodrama about illegitimacy, and followed it with the social drama "Dharmputra" (1961).

title: Yash Chopra
text: Chopra rose to prominence after directing the commercially and critically successful drama, "Waqt" (1965), which pioneered the concept of ensemble casts in Bollywood.

title: Yash Chopra
text: In 1971, he founded his own production company, Yash Raj Films, whose first production was "Daag" (1973), a successful melodrama about a polygamous man.

title: Yash Chopra
text: His success continued in the seventies, with some of Indian cinema's most successful and iconic films, including the action thriller "Deewaar" (1975), which established Amitabh Bachchan as the leading actor in Bollywood; the romantic drama "Kabhie Kabhie" (1976) and "Trishul" (1978).

title: Yash Chopra
text: This was followed by a period of professional setback from the late 1970s to 1989.

title: Yash Chopra
text: Chopra collaborated with Sridevi in two of what has been considered to be his finest films; the romantic musical "Chandni" (1989), which became instrumental in ending the era of violent films in Bollywood and returning to musicals, and the romantic drama "Lamhe" (1991), considered by critics and Chopra himself to be his best work, but underperformed at the domestic box office although brought profits overseas.

title: Yash Chopra
text: After helming the critically panned "Parampara" (1993), Chopra directed the commercially successful psychological thriller "Darr" (1993), the first of his films to star Shah Rukh Khan.

title: Yash Chopra
text: Chopra directed three more romantic films, all starring Khan; "Dil To Pagal Hai" (1997), "Veer-Zaara" (2004) and "Jab Tak Hai Jaan" (2012), before announcing his retirement from direction in 2012.

title: Yash Chopra
text: He died of dengue fever during "Jab Tak Hai Jaan"s production in 2012.

title: Pamela Chopra

title: Pamela Chopra

title: Princess Augusta of Saxe-Gotha
text: Princess Augusta of Saxe-Gotha-Altenburg (– 8 February 1772) was Princess of Wales by marriage to Frederick, Prince of Wales.

title: Princess Augusta of Saxe-Gotha
text: She was one of only four Princesses of Wales who never became queen consort, as her eldest son succeeded her father-in-law as George III of the United Kingdom in 1760 rather than her spouse, who had died nine years earlier.

title: Princess Augusta of Saxe-Gotha
text: Augusta was presumptive regent of Great Britain in the event of a regency between the death of her spouse in 1751, until the majority of her son in 1756, though in the event her father-in-law, George II, lived until 1760.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Lavinia Jannetta Horton Ryves, née Lavinia Serres( 16 March 1797 – 7 December 1871), was a British woman claiming to be a member of the British royal family, calling herself" Princess Lavinia of Cumberland".

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Born in Liverpool, England, Lavinia was the daughter of Olivia Serres and John Thomas Serres.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Olivia Serres gained notoriety by claiming to be the daughter of Prince Henry, Duke of Cumberland and Strathearn, a younger brother of King George III of the United Kingdom.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: In 1822 Lavinia married Anthony Ryves, a portrait painter.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: They were divorced in 1841.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: In 1844" Princess Lavinia" tried to take Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington to court for having" overlooked", as George III's executor, a bequest of £ 15,000 to Olivia.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: In 1850 Lavinia published a pamphlet requesting financial aid from Queen Victoria.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: In 1866, aged sixty- nine, Princess Lavinia asked the Court of Probate to declare her the legitimate granddaughter of the Duke of Cumberland and award her the £ 15,000 bequest" left" by George III.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: In the process of the 1866 trial, Lavinia produced several remarkable documents attesting to her claims, and a handwriting expert testified to the authenticity of George III's and James Wilmot's signatures.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Testimony was introduced that in fact the Duke of Kent had supported Olivia financially, and had spoken of Olivia as" my cousin Serres", apparently believing her story.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: The trial was most considered remarkable, perhaps, for the claims made by Dr. Walter Smith, Lavinia's barrister, that George III had been privately married to a Quaker, Hannah Lightfoot, and that in consequence thereof, neither George IV nor Queen Victoria had any right to the throne.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Lavinia's case, however, quickly ran into difficulties: in some of the submitted documents, George III had" signed" his name as" George Guelph"; in others, William Pitt and Lord Brook had" signed" as earls before they had in fact become earls.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: The court found that Lavinia was the legitimate daughter of John and Olivia Serres and was not the granddaughter of the Duke of Cumberland.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: The court did not prosecute Lavinia for forgery: Lavinia maintained she believed in good faith that the documents left her by Olivia were genuine.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: It is thought that the documents were in fact forged at the behest of Olivia, rather than Lavinia, perhaps by William FitzClarence, Olivia's boyfriend, who had calligraphic talents.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: Lavinia continued to write pamphlets in support of her claims, and her case was reheard by the House of Lords.

title: Lavinia Ryves
text: She died with her claims unrecognized.

title: Timecode (2000 film)
text: Timecode is a 2000 American experimental film written and directed by Mike Figgis and featuring a large ensemble cast, including Salma Hayek, Stellan Skarsgård, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Suzy Nakamura, Kyle MacLachlan, Saffron Burrows, Holly Hunter, Julian Sands, Xander Berkeley, Leslie Mann and Mía Maestro.

title: Timecode (2000 film)
text: The film is constructed from four continuous 93- minute takes that were filmed simultaneously by four cameramen; the screen is divided into quarters, and the four shots are shown simultaneously.

title: Timecode (2000 film)

title: Battle of Wei River
text: The Battle of Wei River (濰水之戰) was fought in 204 BC between the Han and a combined force of Qi and Western Chu.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: The famous General Han Xin led the Han force, while the Qi were led by Prince Tian Guang (田廣), and the Chu by Long Ju (龍且).

title: Battle of Wei River
text: It was one of the most important battles of the Chu-Han Contention.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: In 205 BC, Han Xin had captured most of the modern Hebei and Shanxi provinces, the principalities of Zhao, and Dai, and was starting to march on the principality of Qi.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Prince Tian Guang, persuaded by noted diplomat Li Yiji (酈食其), had decided to acknowledge the leadership of Han and its king, Liu Bang.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: However, Liu Bang did not officially notify Han Xin.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Ignorant of Prince Tian Guang's intentions, Han Xin decided to launch a surprise attack against Qi, under the counsel of Kuai Tong.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Tian Guang's forces were completely surprised.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Tian Guang fled and sought assistance from King Xiang Yu of Western Chu, pledging fealty.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Xiang Yu sent a strong expeditionary force, including some elite cavalry, under Long Ju to relieve Qi.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Han Xin knew that Long, noted for his personal bravery and fighting prowess, was too arrogant.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: The night before the battle, he set a trap for Long by building a makeshift dam with sandbags to lower the water level in the Wei river.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Long was counselled to fight a slow battle of attrition since he had forces to spare

title: Battle of Wei River
text: (the force ratio was about 1:3 in favour of Chu).

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Long declined, believing he had overwhelming forces and that Han Xin was a coward, as a result of an incident when Han Xin served in the Chu forces.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: (Han Xin had crawled between the legs of some thugs to avoid a conflict when he was outnumbered.)

title: Battle of Wei River
text: The next morning, Han Xin marched across the lowered river and attacked Long's forces.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Then, he made a strategic retreat by tricking Long into charging his army across the river.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: When about one quarter of the Chu army had crossed, Han signalled for his men to open the dam.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: That succeeded in drowning many of the Chu soldiers and isolating Long Ju, with only a fraction of his force.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Cut off by the river, Long Ju had nowhere to go and was cut down in battle.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: The rest of the Chu army disintegrated, when Han Xin continued to press his attack.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Prince Tian Guang fled and was eventually caught and killed.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: This battle was strategically significant since it cost Xiang Yu between half and a third of his forces, including many veterans, depleted Chu of important reserves and prevented any future possibility of Xiang Yu fighting successfully on two fronts.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: Eventually, Xiang Yu lost the war.

title: Battle of Wei River
text: It is not known why Xiang Yu did not lead the Chu army into battle himself to fight against the now well regarded Han Xin.

title: Zhang Liang (Western Han)
text: Zhang Liang( 3rd century BC – 186 BC), courtesy name Zifang, was a strategist and statesman who lived in the early Western Han dynasty.

title: Zhang Liang (Western Han)
text: He is also known as one of the" Three Heroes of the early Han dynasty"( 漢初三傑), along with Han Xin( 韓 信) and Xiao He. Zhang Liang contributed greatly to the establishment of the Han dynasty.

title: Zhang Liang (Western Han)
text: After his death, he was honoured with the posthumous title" Marquis Wencheng" by Emperor Qianshao.

title: Wei Zhaodu
text: Wei Zhaodu( 韋昭度)( died June 4, 895), courtesy name Zhengji( 正紀), formally the Duke of Qi( 岐公), was an official of the Chinese dynasty Tang Dynasty, serving as a chancellor during the reigns of Emperor Xizong and Emperor Xizong's brother Emperor Zhaozong.

title: Wei Zhaodu
text: With imperial power dwindling, Wei's fellow chancellor Cui Zhaowei, who associated with the warlords Li Maozhen, Wang Xingyu, and Han Jian, encouraged Li, Wang, and Han to march on the capital Chang'an, and the three warlords, once they arrived there, put Wei and fellow chancellor Li Xi to death.

title: David Ji
text: David Longfen Ji is an American businessman who co-founded Apex Digital, an electronics manufacturer.

title: David Ji

title: David Ji
text: Changhong accused him of defrauding them through bad checks.

title: David Ji
text: Ji was taken, according to an account by his lawyer, to the senior management and told, "I decide whether you live or die."

title: David Ji
text: He has been held in China without charges.

title: David Ji
text: Ji's case highlighted an "implicit racism" in dealings with American businessmen.

title: David Ji
text: As a U.S. citizen he was not granted the same treatment by authorities as non-ethnically Chinese businessmen sharing the same nationality.

title: Han Xin
text: Han Xin( died 196 BC) was a military general who served Liu Bang during the Chu – Han Contention and contributed greatly to the founding of the Han dynasty.

title: Han Xin
text: Han Xin was named as one of the" Three Heroes of the early Han dynasty", along with Zhang Liang and Xiao He.

title: Han Xin
text: Han Xin is best remembered as a brilliant military leader for the strategies and tactics he employed in warfare, some of which became the origins of certain Chinese idioms.

title: Han Xin
text: In recognition of Han Xin's contributions, Liu Bang conferred the titles of" King of Qi" on him in 203 BC and" King of Chu" in the following year.

title: Han Xin
text: However, Liu Bang feared Han Xin's growing influence and gradually reduced his authority, demoting him to" Marquis of Huaiyin" in late 202 BC.

title: Han Xin
text: In 196 BC, Han Xin was accused of participating in a rebellion and lured into a trap and executed on Empress Lü Zhi's orders.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Tali-Ihantala 1944 is a 2007 Finnish war film directed by Åke Lindman and Sakari Kirjavainen, based on the Battle of Tali-Ihantala.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Filming began during the summer of 2006 and was screened in autumn 2007.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Lindman wanted the film to be as real as possible, and only include facts.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: He also wanted Finns to remember the sacrifices the soldiers made in those battles.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: The film received 350,000 euros in production support from the Finnish Film Foundation.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: The organization created to raise money for the movie was led by Admiral Jan Klenberg and was protected by former Finnish President Mauno Koivisto.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: The movie was made using a wide array of genuine wartime vehicles and, when it was not possible to acquire originals, replicas were used.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Some of the tanks used were vehicles which had participated in the actual real-life battles depicted in the film and had been stored in a museum.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Also used was a Focke-Wulf Fw 190 replica made by the German company Flug Werk.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: During the shooting of the movie, the aircraft was decorated with markings similar to that of Major Erich Rudorffer's aircraft in 1944.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: The reception for the film was mixed.

title: Tali-Ihantala 1944
text: Most of the criticism was targeted at the lack of main characters and a proper plot.

title: Greg MacGillivray

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: Grand Canyon Adventure:

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: River at Risk is a 2008 American documentary film directed by Greg MacGillivray and narrated by Robert Redford.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: It was released to IMAX 3D Theaters in 2008.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: Anthropologist Wade Davis and river advocate Robert F. Kennedy Jr journey down the Colorado River on a two-week expedition to highlight water conservation issues.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: Traveling by rafts, kayaks and wooden dories, they are accompanied by their daughters and guided by Shana Watahomigie, a Native American National Park ranger.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: The film explores America's drought and freshwater shortages, the impact on the river of damming, and human water supply needs, such as that of the city of Las Vegas.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: Shot in four weeks almost entirely on the Colorado River, the challenging production, which features the first 3D IMAX images of the Grand Canyon, took the 350-pound 3D IMAX camera through its paces and involved the cooperation of three Indian nations, the National Park Service, film sponsor Teva’s team of kayakers and more than a dozen experienced river guides.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: The production represents the largest filmmaking expedition in the canyon's recent history and the last major film production of its magnitude to be shot in the canyon due to new protective restrictions on the number of crew members and equipment allowed.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: The film is directed by IMAX director and cinematographer Greg MacGillivray, who previously explored similar conservation themes in his Academy Award-nominated films "The Living Sea" and "Dolphins", also filmed for IMAX Theaters.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: The film won Best Cinematography of the Year and a Special Achievement in Filmmaking Award for the opening 3D title sequence from the Giant Screen Cinema Association.

title: Grand Canyon Adventure: River at Risk
text: It also won a Golden Reel Award for Best Sound Editing by the Motion Picture Sound Editors USA and was nominated for a VES Award for Outstanding Visual Effects by the Visual Effects Society.

text: He was also an MLA, elected from the Islampur constituency in the 2011 West Bengal state assembly election.

title: Abdul Karim Chowdhury
text: Before this term he had been elected for 10 terms in MLA.

title: Abdul Karim Chowdhury
text: He is one of the veteran leader of West Bengal.

title: Abdul Karim Chowdhury
text: He is very down to earth.

title: Abdul Karim Chowdhury
